text: A vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah Kings of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O heavens, and hearken, O earth: for the Lord hath said, I have nourished and brought up children, but they have rebelled against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: but Israel hath not known: my people hath not understood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ah, sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity: a seed of the wicked, corrupt children: they have forsaken the Lord: they have provoked the Holy one of Israel to anger: they are gone backward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore should ye be smitten anymore? for ye fall away more and more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart is heavy.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sole of the foot unto the head, there is nothing whole therein, but wounds and swelling, and sores full of corruption: they have not been wrapped, nor bound up nor mollified with oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your land is waste: your cities are burnt with fire: strangers devour your land in your presence, and it is desolate like the overthrow of strangers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the daughter of Zion shall remain like a cottage in a vineyard, like a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, and like a besieged city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except the Lord of hosts had reserved unto us even a small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, and should have been like unto Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the word of the Lord, O princes of Sodom: hearken unto the Law of our God, O people of Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: What have I to do with the multitude of your sacrifices, saith the Lord? I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and of the fat of fed beasts: and I desire not the blood of bullocks, nor of lambs, nor of goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: When ye come to appear before me, who required this of your hands to tread in my courts?
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring no more oblations, in vain: incense is an abomination unto me: I cannot suffer your new moons, nor Sabbath, nor solemn days (it is iniquity) nor solemn assemblies.
speaker: Narrator

text: My soul hateth your new moons and your appointed feasts: they are a burden unto me: I am weary to bear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you shall stretch out your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: and though ye make many prayers, I will not hear: for your hands are full of blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wash you, make you clean, take away the evil of your works from before mine eyes: cease to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Learn to do well: seek judgment, relieve the oppressed: judge the fatherless, and defend the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come now, and let us reason together, saith the Lord: though your sins were as crimson, they shall be made white as snow: though they were red like scarlet, they shall be as wool,
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye consent and obey, ye shall eat the good things of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye refuse and be rebellious, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: How is the faithful city become an harlot? it was full of judgment, and justice lodged therein, but now they are murderers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy silver is become dross: thy wine is mixed with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves: every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the widow’s cause come before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore saith the Lord God of hosts, the Mighty one of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will turn mine hand upon thee, and burn out thy dross, till it be pure, and take away all thy tin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will restore thy Judges as at the first, and thy counselors as at the beginning: afterward shalt thou be called a city of righteousness, and a faithful city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zion shall be redeemed in judgment, and they that return in her, in justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners shall be together: and they that forsake the Lord, shall be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall be confounded for the oaks, which ye have desired, and ye shall be ashamed of the gardens that ye have chosen,
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall be as an oak, whose leaf fadeth: and as a garden that hath no water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker thereof as a spark: and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw upon Judah and Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be in the last days, that the mountain of the House of the Lord shall be prepared in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills, and all nations shall flow unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many people shall go, and say, Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us his ways, and we will walk in his paths, for the Law shall go forth of Zion, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall judge among the nations, and rebuke many people: they shall break their swords also into mattocks, and their spears into scythes: nation shall not lift up a sword against nation, neither shall they learn to fight anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the Law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thou hast forsaken thy people, the house of Jacob, because they are full of the East manners, and are sorcerers as the Philistines, and abound with strange children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land also was full of silver and gold, and there was none end of their treasures: and their land was full of horses, and their chariots were infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their land was also full of idols; they worshipped the work of their own hands, which their own fingers have made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a man bowed himself, and a man humbled himself: therefore spare them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust from before the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his Majesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high look of man shall be humbled, and the loftiness of men shall be abased, and the Lord only shall be exalted in that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the day of the Lord of hosts is upon all the proud and haughty, and upon all that is exalted: and it shall be made low.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and exalted, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon every high tower, and upon every strong wall,
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the haughtiness of men shall be brought low, and the loftiness of men shall be abased, and the Lord shall only be exalted in that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the idols will he utterly destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall they go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth from before the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his majesty, when he shall arise to destroy the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that day shall man cast away his silver idols and his golden idols (which they had made themselves to worship them) to the moles, and to the backs,
speaker: Narrator

text: To go into the holes of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks from before the fear of the Lord, and from the glory of his majesty, when he shall rise to destroy the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease you from the man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be esteemed?
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the Lord God of hosts will take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the strength: even all the stay of bread, and all the stay of water,
speaker: Narrator

text: The strong man, and the man of war, the judge, and the Prophet, the prudent and the aged,
speaker: Narrator

text: The captain of fifty, and the honorable, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and eloquent man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will appoint children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people shall be oppressed one of another, and every one by his neighbor: the children shall presume against the ancient, and the vile against the honorable.
speaker: Narrator

text: When everyone shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and say, Thou hast clothing, thou shalt be our prince, and let this fall be under thine hand:
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day he shall swear, saying, I cannot be an helper: for there is no bread in mine house, nor clothing: therefore make me no prince of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless Jerusalem is fallen, and Judah is fallen down, because their tongue and works are against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The trial of their countenance testifieth against them, yea, they declare their sins, as Sodom, they hide them not. Woe be unto their souls: for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say ye, Surely it shall be well with the just: for they shall eat the fruit of their works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe be to the wicked, it shall be evil with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children are extortioners of my people, and women have rule over them: O my people, they that lead thee, cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord standeth up to plead, yea, he standeth to judge the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall enter into judgment with the Ancients of his people and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard: the spoil of the poor is in your houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: What have ye to do that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor, saith the Lord, even the Lord of hosts?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched out necks, and with wandering eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the Lord make the heads of the daughters of Zion bald, and the Lord shall discover their secret parts.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the Lord take away the ornament of the slippers, and the cauls, and the round tyres,
speaker: Narrator

text: The sweet balls, and the bracelets, and the bonnets,
speaker: Narrator

text: The tyres of the head, and the slops, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings,
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings and the mufflers,
speaker: Narrator

text: The costly apparel and the veils, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glasses and the fine linen, and the hoods and the lawns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And instead of sweet savor, there shall be stink, and instead of girdle, a rent, and instead of dressing of the hair, baldness, and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth, and burning instead of beauty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy strength in the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall her gates mourn and lament, and she being desolate, shall sit upon the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall seven women take hold of one man, saying, We will eat our own bread, and we will wear our own garments: only let us be called by thy name, and take away our reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the bud of the Lord be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the earth shall be excellent and pleasant for them that are escaped of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he that shall be left in Zion, and he that shall remain in Jerusalem, shall be called holy, and every one shall be written among the living in Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord shall wash the filthiness of the daughters of Zion, and purge the blood of Jerusalem out of the midst thereof by the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall create upon every place of mount Zion, and upon the assemblies thereof, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory shall be a defense.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a covering shall be for a shadow in the day for the heat, and a place of refuge and a covert for the storm and for the rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now will I sing to my beloved a song of my beloved to his vineyard, My beloved had a vineyard in a very fruitful hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hedged it, and gathered out the stones of it, and he planted it with the best plants, and he built a tower in the midst thereof, and made a winepress therein, then he looked that it should bring forth grapes: but it brought forth wild grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, between me and my vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What could I have done anymore to my vineyard that I have not done unto it? why have I looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it bringeth forth wild grapes?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up: I will break the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will lay it waste: it shall not be cut, nor dug, but briers and thorns shall grow up: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the vineyard of the Lord of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah are his pleasant plant, and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression: for righteousness, but behold a crying.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that join house to house, and lay field to field, till there be no place, that ye may be placed by yourselves in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is in mine ears, saith the Lord of hosts. Surely many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair without inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ten acres of vines shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them, that rise up early to follow drunkenness, and to them that continue until night, till the wine do inflame them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the harp and viol, timbrel and pipe, and wine are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the Lord, neither consider the work of his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my people is gone into captivity, because they had no knowledge, and the glory thereof are men famished, and the multitude thereof is dried up with thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hell hath enlarged itself, and hath opened his mouth without measure, and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth among them, shall descend into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And man shall be brought down, and man shall be humbled, even the eyes of the proud shall be humbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and the holy God shall be sanctified in justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the strangers shall eat the desolate places of the fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin, as with cart ropes:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which say, Let him make speed: let him hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, that we may know it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that speak good of evil, and evil of good, which put darkness for light, and light for darkness, that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for sour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and unto them that are strong to pour in strong drink:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which justify the wicked for a reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore as the flame of fire devoureth the stubble, and as the chaff is consumed of the flame: so their root shall be a rottenness, and their bud shall rise up like dust, because they have cast off the Law of the Lord of hosts, and contemned the word of the Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore is the wrath of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched out his hand upon them, and hath smitten them that the mountains did tremble: and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets, and for all this his wrath was not turned away, but his hand was stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will lift up a sign unto the nations afar, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and behold, they shall come hastily with speed.
speaker: Narrator

text: None shall faint nor fall among them: none shall slumber nor sleep, neither shall the girdle of his loins be loosed, nor the latchet of his shoes be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all his bows bent: his horse hoofs shall be thought like flint, and his wheels like whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator

text: His roaring shall be like a lion, and he shall roar like lion’s whelps: they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey: they shall take it away, and none shall deliver it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day they shall roar upon them, as the roaring of the sea: and if they look unto the earth, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light shall be darkened in their sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year of the death of king Uzziah, I saw also the Lord sitting upon an high throne, and lifted up, and the lower parts thereof filled the Temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Seraphims stood upon it, every one had six wings: with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one cried to another, and said, Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts: the whole world is full of his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lintels of the door cheeks moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, Woe is me: for I am undone, because I am a man of polluted lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of polluted lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, and Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then flew one of the Seraphims unto me with an hot coal in his hand, which he had taken from the altar with the tongs:
speaker: Narrator

text: And he touched my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips, and thine iniquity shall be taken away, and thy sin shall be purged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send? and who shall go for us? Then I said, Here am I, send me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Go, and say unto this people, Ye shall hear indeed, but ye shall not understand: ye shall plainly see, and not perceive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make the heart of this people fat, make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes, lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and he heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord have removed men far away, and there be a great desolation in the midst of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But yet in it shall be a tenth, and shall return, and shall be eaten up as an elm or an oak, which have a substance in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the days of Ahaz, the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah king of Judah, Rezin the king of Aram came up, and Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel, to Jerusalem to fight against it, but he could not overcome it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told the house of David, saying, Aram is joined with Ephraim: therefore his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest are moved by the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz (thou and Shear-Jashub thy son) at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, in the path of the fuller’s field,
speaker: Narrator

text: And say unto him, Take heed, and be still: fear not, neither be fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the furious wrath of Rezin and of Aram, and of Remaliah’s son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because Aram hath taken wicked counsel against thee, and Ephraim and Remaliah’s son, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us go up against Judah, and let us waken them up, and make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst thereof, even the son of Tabel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord God, It shall not stand, neither shall it be.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin: and within five and threescore years, Ephraim shall be destroyed from being a people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If ye believe not, surely ye shall not be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake again unto Ahaz, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask a sign for thee of the Lord thy God: ask it either in the depth beneath, or in the height above.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Hear you now, O house of David, is it a small thing for you to grieve men, that ye will also grieve my God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and she shall call his name Immanuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Butter and honey shall he eat, till he have knowledge to refuse the evil, and to choose the good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For afore the child shall have knowledge to eschew the evil, and to choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest, shall be forsaken of both her kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy Father’s house (the days that are not come from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah) even the King of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall the Lord hiss for the fly that is at the uttermost parts of the floods of Egypt, and for the Bee which is in the land of Assyria,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall come and shall light all in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorny places, and upon all bushy places.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, even by them beyond the River, by the King of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet, and it shall consume the beard.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the same day shall a man nourish a young cow, and two sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the abundance of milk, that they shall give, he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall everyone eat, which is left within the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the same day every place, wherein shall be a thousand vines, shall be at a thousand pieces of silver: so it shall be for the briers and for the thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: With arrows and with bow shall one come thither: because all the land shall be briers and thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on all the mountains, which shall be dug with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns: but they shall be for the sending out of bullocks, and for the treading of sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the Lord said unto me, Take thee a great roll, and write it with a man’s pen, Make speed to the spoil: haste to the prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I took unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the Priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, I came unto the Prophetess, which conceived, and bare a son. Then said the Lord to me, Call his name, Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father, and my mother, he shall take away the riches of Damascus, and the spoil of Samaria, before the King of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake yet again unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because this people hath refused the waters of Shiloah that run softly, and rejoice with Rezin, and the son of Remaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the River mighty and great, even the King of Assyria with all his glory, and he shall come up upon all their rivers, and go over all their banks,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall break into Judah, and shall overflow, and pass through, and shall come up to the neck, and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather together on heaps, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces, and hearken all ye of far countries: gird yourselves, and you shall be broken in pieces: gird yourselves, and you shall be broken in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take counsel together, yet, it shall be brought to naught: pronounce a decree, yet shall it not stand: for God is with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord spake thus to me, in taking of mine hand, and taught me, that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Say ye not, A confederacy, to all them to whom this people saith a confederacy, neither fear you their fear, nor be afraid of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify the Lord of hosts, and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread,
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be as a Sanctuary: but as a stumbling stone, and as a rock to fall upon, to both the houses of Israel, and as a snare and as a net to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many among them shall stumble, and shall fall, and shall be broken, and shall be snared, and shall be taken,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind up the testimony: seal up the Law among my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will wait upon the Lord that hath hid his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I and the children whom the Lord hath given me, are as signs and as wonders in Israel, by the Lord of hosts, which dwelleth in Mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they shall say unto you, Inquire at them that have a spirit of divination, and at the soothsayers which whisper and murmur, Should not a people inquire at their God? from the living to the dead?
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Law, and to the testimony, if they speak not according to this word: it is because there is no light in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he that is afflicted and famished, shall go to and fro in it: and when he shall be hungry, he shall even fret himself, and curse his king and his gods, and shall look upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he shall look to the earth, behold trouble, and darkness, vexation, and anguish, and he is driven to darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the darkness shall not be according to the affliction, that it had when at the first he touched lightly the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, nor afterward when he was more grievous by the way of the sea beyond Jordan in Galilee of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people that walked in darkness, have seen a great light: they that dwelled in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast multiplied the nation, and not increased their joy: they have rejoiced before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide a spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the yoke of their burden, and the staff of their shoulder, and the rod of their oppressor hast thou broken, as in the day of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely every battle of the warrior is with noise, and with tumbling of garments in blood: but this shall be with burning, and devouring of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto us a child is born, and unto us a Son is given: and the government is upon his shoulder, and he shall call his name, Wonderful, Counselor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The prince of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The increase of his government and peace shall have none end: he shall sit upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to order it, and to stablish it with judgment, and with justice, from henceforth, even forever: the zeal of the Lord of hosts will perform this.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath sent a word into Jacob, and it lighted upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim, and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in the pride and presumption of their heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: The bricks are fallen, but we will build it with hewn stones: the wild fig trees are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the Lord will raise up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aram before and the Philistines behind, and they shall devour Israel with open mouth: yet for all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will the Lord cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush in one day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ancient and the honorable man, he is the head: and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the leaders of the people cause them to err: and they that are led by them are devoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the Lord have no pleasure in their young men, neither will he have compassion of their fatherless and of their widows: for everyone is an hypocrite and wicked, and every mouth speaketh folly: yet for all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wickedness burneth as a fire: it devoureth the briers and the thorns, and will kindle in the thick places of the forest: and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the wrath of the Lord of hosts shall the land be darkened, and the people shall be as the meat of the fire: no man shall spare his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall snatch at the right hand, and be hungry: and he shall eat on the left hand, and shall not be satisfied: everyone shall eat the flesh of his own arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Manasseh Ephraim: and Ephraim Manasseh, and they both shall be against Judah: yet for all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that decree wicked decrees, and write grievous things,
speaker: Narrator

text: To keep back the poor from judgment, and to take away the judgment of the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may spoil the fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: What will ye do now in the day of visitation, and of destruction, which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help and where will ye leave your glory?
speaker: Narrator

text: Without me everyone shall fall among them that are bound, and they shall fall down among the slain: yet for all this his wrath is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Assyria, the rod of my wrath: and the staff in their hands is mine indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send him to a dissembling nation, and I will give him a charge against the people of my wrath to take the spoil and to take the prey, and to tread them under feet like the mire in the street.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he thinketh not so, neither doth his heart esteem it so: but he imagineth to destroy and to cut off not a few nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he saith, Are not my princes altogether Kings?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?
speaker: Narrator

text: Like as mine hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, seeing their idols were above Jerusalem, and above Samaria:
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall not I, as I have done to Samaria, and to the idols thereof, so do to Jerusalem, and to the idols thereof?
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Lord hath accomplished all his work upon mount Zion and Jerusalem, I will visit the fruit of the proud heart of the king of Assyria, and his glorious and proud looks,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he said, By the power of mine own hand have I done it, and by my wisdom, because I am wise: therefore I have removed the borders of the people, and have spoiled their treasures, and have pulled down the inhabitants like a valiant man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And mine hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people, and as one that gathereth eggs that are left, so have I gathered all the earth: and there was none to move the wing or to open the mouth, or to whisper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall the saw exalt itself against him that moveth it? as if the rod should lift up itself against him that taketh it up, or the staff should exalt itself as it were no wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the Lord God of hosts send among his fat men leanness, and under his glory he shall kindle a burning, like the burning of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the light of Israel shall be as a fire, and the Holy one thereof as a flame, and it shall burn, and devour his thorns and his briers in one day:
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful fields both soul and flesh: and he shall be as the fainting of a standard bearer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may tell them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that day shall the remnant of Israel and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, stay no more upon him that smote them, but shall stay upon the Lord, the Holy one of Israel in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob unto the mighty God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For though thy people, O Israel, be as the sand of the sea, yet shall the remnant of them return. The consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord God of hosts shall make the consumption even determined, in the midst of all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts, O my people, that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of Assyria: he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee after the manner of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But yet a very little time, and the wrath shall be consumed, and mine anger in their destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord of hosts shall raise up a scourge for him, according to the plague of Midian in the rock Oreb: and as his staff was upon the Sea, so he will lift it up after the manner of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that day shall his burden be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck: and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is come to Aiath: he is passed into Migron: at Michmash shall he lay up his armor.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have gone over the ford: they lodged in the lodging at Geba: Ramah is afraid: Gibeah of Saul is fled away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thy voice, O daughter Gallim, cause Laish to hear, O poor Anathoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Madmenah is removed: the inhabitants of Gebim have gathered themselves together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet there is a time that he will stay at Nob: he shall lift up his hand toward the mount of the daughter Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord God of hosts shall cut off the bough with fear, and they of high stature shall be cut off, and the high shall be humbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall cut away the thick places of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall have a mighty fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there shall come a rod forth of the stock of Jesse, and a grass shall grow out of his roots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him: the Spirit of wisdom and understanding, the Spirit of counsel and strength, the Spirit of knowledge, and of the fear of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall make him prudent in the fear of the Lord: for he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove by the hearing of his ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and with equity shall he reprove for the meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: And justice shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie with the kid, and the calf, and the lion, and the fat beast together, and a little child shall lead them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the cow and the bear shall feed: their young ones shall lie together: and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sucking child shall play upon the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand upon the cockatrice hole.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall none hurt nor destroy in all the mountain of mine holiness: for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters that cover the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day the root of Jesse, which shall stand up for a sign unto the people, the nations shall seek unto it, and his rest shall be glorious.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the same day shall the Lord stretch out his hand again the second time, to possess the remnant of his people, (which shall be left) of Assyria, and of Egypt, and of Pathros, and of Ethiopia, and of Elam, and of Shinar, and of Hamath, and of the isles of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall set up a sign to the nations, and assemble the dispersed of Israel, and gather the scattered of Judah from the four corners of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hatred also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, neither shall Judah vex Ephraim:
speaker: Narrator

text: But they shall flee upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the West: they shall spoil them of the East together: Edom and Moab shall be the stretching out of their hands, and the children of Ammon in their obedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian’s sea, and with his mighty wind shall lift up his hand over the river, and shall smite him in his seven streams, and cause men to walk therein with shoes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a path to the remnant of his people which are left of Assyria, like as it was unto Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt say in that day, O Lord, I will praise thee: though thou wast angry with me, thy wrath is turned away, and thou comfortest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, God is my salvation: I will trust, and will not fear: for the Lord God is my strength and song: he is also become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore with joy shall ye draw waters out of the wells of salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall say in that day, Praise the Lord: call upon his Name: declare his works among the people: make mention of them, for his Name is exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord, for he hath done excellent things: this is known in all the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cry out, and shout, O inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy one of Israel in the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Babel, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up a standard upon the high mountain: lift up the voice unto them: wag the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have commanded them, that I have sanctified: and I have called the mighty to my wrath, and them that rejoice in my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The noise of a multitude is in the mountains like a great people: a tumultuous voice of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together: the Lord of hosts numbereth the host of the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They come from a far country, from the end of the heaven: even the Lord with the weapons of his wrath to destroy the whole land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl you, for the day of the Lord is at hand: it shall come as a destroyer from the Almighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall all hands be weakened, and all men’s hearts shall melt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be afraid: anguish and sorrow shall take them, and they shall have pain, as a woman that travaileth: everyone shall be amazed at his neighbor, and their faces shall be like flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger to lay the land waste: and he shall destroy the sinners out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the stars of heaven and the planets thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will visit the wickedness upon the world, and their iniquity upon the wicked, and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will cast down the pride of tyrants.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make a man more precious than fine gold, even a man above the wedge of gold of Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will shake the heaven, and the earth shall remove out of her place in the wrath of the Lord of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be as a chased Doe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up; every man shall turn to his own people, and flee each one to his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone that is found, shall be stricken through: and whosoever joineth himself, shall fall by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their children also shall be broken in pieces before their eyes: their houses shall be spoiled; and their wives ravished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver, nor be desirous of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: With bows also shall they destroy the children, and shall have no compassion upon the fruit of the womb, and their eyes shall not spare the children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Babel the glory of kingdoms, the beauty and pride of the Chaldeans, shall be as the destruction of God in Sodom and Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be inhabited forever, neither shall it be dwelled in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch his tents there, neither shall their shepherds make their folds there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zijm shall lodge there, and their houses shall be full of Ohim: Ostriches shall dwell there, and the Satyrs shall dance there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Iim shall cry in their palaces, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and the time thereof is ready to come, and the days thereof shall not be prolonged.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will have compassion of Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and cause them to rest in their own land: and the stranger shall join himself unto them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people shall receive them and bring them to their own place, and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the Lord, for servants and handmaids: and they shall take them prisoners, whose captives they were, and have rule over their oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day when the Lord shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the sore bondage, wherein thou didst serve,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou take up this proverb against the King of Babel, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased? and the gold thirsty Babel rested?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath broken the rod of the wicked, and the scepter of the rulers:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which smote the people in anger with a continual plague, and ruled the nations in wrath: if any were persecuted, he did not let.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole world is at rest and is quiet: they sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the fir trees rejoiced of thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid down, no hewer came up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hell beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming, raising up the dead for thee, even all the princes of the earth, and hath raised from their thrones all the Kings of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they shall cry and say unto thee, Art thou become weak also as we? art thou become like unto us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the sound of the viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning? and cut down to the ground, which didst cast lots upon the nations?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou saidest in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, and exalt my throne above beside the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation in the sides of the North.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will ascend above the height of the clouds, and I will be like the most high.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt be brought down to the grave, to the side of the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that see thee, shall look upon thee and consider thee, saying, Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, and that did shake the kingdoms?
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof, and opened not the house of his prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kings of the nations, even they all sleep in glory, everyone in his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch: like the raiment of those that are slain, and thrust through with a sword, which go down to the stones of the pit, as a carcass trodden under feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not be joined with them in the grave, because thou hast destroyed thine own land, and slain thy people: the seed of the wicked shall not be renowned forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare a slaughter for his children, for the iniquity of their fathers: let them not rise up nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will rise up against them (saith the Lord of hosts) and will cut off from Babel the name and the remnant, and the son, and the nephew, saith the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make it a possession to the hedgehog, and pools of water, and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of hosts hath sworn, saying, Surely like as I have purposed, so shall it come to pass, and as I have consulted, it shall stand:
speaker: Narrator

text: That I will break to pieces Assyria in my land, and upon my mountains will I tread him under foot, so that his yoke shall depart from them, and his burden shall be taken from off their shoulder.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the counsel that is consulted upon the whole world, and this is the hand stretched out over all the nations,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the Lord of hosts hath determined, and who shall disannul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it away?
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year that king Ahaz died, was this burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice not, (thou whole Philistia) because the rod of him that did beat thee is broken: for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth a cockatrice, and the fruit thereof shall be a fiery flying serpent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the first born of the poor shall be fed, and the needy shall lie down in safety: and I will kill thy root with famine, and it shall slay thy remnant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl, O gate, cry, O city: thou whole land of Philistia art dissolved, for there shall come from the North a smoke, and none shall be alone, at his time appointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall then one answer the messengers of the Gentiles? that the Lord hath stablished Zion, and the poor of his people shall trust in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Moab. Surely Ar of Moab was destroyed, and brought to silence in a night: surely Kir of Moab was destroyed, and brought to silence in a night.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall go up to the Temple, and to Dibon to the high places to weep: for Nebo and for Medeba shall Moab howl: upon all their heads shall be baldness, and every beard shaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: In their streets shall they be girded with sackcloth: on the tops of their houses, and in their streets everyone shall howl, and come down with weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Heshbon shall cry, and Elealeh: their voice shall be heard unto Jahaz: therefore the warriors of Moab shall shout: the soul of everyone shall lament in himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart shall cry for Moab: his fugitives shall flee unto Zoar, an heifer of three years old: for they shall go up with weeping by the mounting up of Luhith: and by the way of Horonaim they shall raise up a cry of destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the waters of Nimrim shall be dried up: therefore the grass is withered, the herbs consumed, and there was no green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore what every man hath left, and their substance shall they bear to the brook of the willows.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cry went round about the borders of Moab, and the howling thereof unto Eglaim, and the skriking thereof unto Beer Elim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the waters of Dimon shall be full of blood: for I will bring more upon Dimon, even lions upon him that escapeth of Moab, and to the remnant of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send ye a lamb to the ruler of the world from the rock of the wilderness, unto the mountain of the daughter Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it shall be as a bird that flieth, and a nest forsaken: the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather a counsel, execute judgment, make thy shadow as the night in the midday: hide them that are chased out: bewray not him that is fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let my banished dwell with thee: Moab, be thou their covert from the face of the destroyer: for the extortioner shall end: the destroyer shall be consumed, and the oppressor shall cease out of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in mercy shall the throne be prepared, and he shall sit upon it in steadfastness, in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard of the pride of Moab (he is very proud) even his pride, and his arrogancy, and his indignation, but his lies shall not be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall Moab howl unto Moab, everyone shall howl: for the foundations of Kir Hareseth shall ye mourn, yet they shall be stricken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the vineyards of Heshbon are cut down, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken the principal vines thereof: they are come unto Jazer: they wandered in the wilderness: her goodly branches stretched out themselves, and went over the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I weep with the weeping of Jazer, and of the vine of Sibmah, O Heshbon: and Elealeh, I will make thee drunk with my tears, because upon thy summer fruits, and upon thy harvest a shouting is fallen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field: and in the vineyards shall be no singing nor shouting for joy: the treader shall not tread wine in the wine presses: I have caused the rejoicing to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore, my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir Heres.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it shall appear that Moab shall be weary of his high places, then shall he come to his temple to pray, but he shall not prevail.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the word that the Lord hath spoken against Moab since that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now the Lord hath spoken, saying, In three years as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned in all the great multitude, and the remnant shall be very small and feeble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, for it shall be a ruinous heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities of Aroer shall be forsaken: they shall be for the flocks: for they shall lie there, and none shall make them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The munition also shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Aram shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day the glory of Jacob shall be made clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be as when the harvest man gathereth the corn, and reapeth the ears with his arm, and he shall be as he that gathereth the ears in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a gathering of grapes shall be left in it: as the shaking of an olive tree, two or three berries are in the top of the upmost boughs, and four or five in the high branches of the fruit thereof, saith the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that day shall a man look to his maker, and his eyes shall look to the holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall not look to the altars, the works of his own hands, neither shall he look to those things which his own fingers have made, as groves and images.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the cities of their strength be as the forsaking of boughs and branches, which they did forsake, because of the children of Israel, and there shall be desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and hast not remembered the God of thy strength, therefore shalt thou set pleasant plants, and shalt graft strange vine branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the day shalt thou make thy plant to grow, and in the morning shalt thou make thy seed to flourish: but the harvest shall be gone in the day of possession, and there shall be desperate sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ah, the multitude of many people, they shall make a sound like the noise of the sea: for the noise of the people shall make a sound like the noise of mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people shall make a sound like the noise of many waters: but God shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and as a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, in the evening there is trouble: but afore the morning it is gone. This is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that rob us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh, the land shadowing with wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sending ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of reeds upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation that is scattered abroad, and spoiled, unto a terrible people from their beginning even hitherto: a nation by little and little even trodden under foot: whose land the floods have spoiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye the inhabitants of the world, and dwellers in the earth, shall see when he setteth up a sign in the mountains, and when he bloweth the trumpet, ye shall hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For so the Lord said unto me, I will rest and behold in my tabernacle, as the heat drying up the rain, and as a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For afore the harvest, when the flour is finished, and the fruit is ripening in the flour, then he shall cut down the branches with hooks, and shall take away, and cut off the boughs:
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be left together unto the fowls of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth: for the fowl shall summer upon it, and every beast of the earth shall winter upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time shall a present be brought unto the Lord of hosts (a people that is scattered abroad, and spoiled, and of a terrible people from their beginning hitherto, a nation by little and little even trodden under foot, whose land the rivers have spoiled) to the place of the name of the Lord of hosts, even the mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Egypt. Behold, the Lord rideth upon a swift cloud, and shall come into Egypt, and the idols of Egypt shall be moved at his presence, and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set the Egyptians against the Egyptians: so everyone shall fight against his brother, and everyone against his neighbor, city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst of her, and I will destroy their counsel, and they shall seek at the idols, and at the sorcerers, and at them that have spirits of divination, and at the soothsayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will deliver the Egyptians into the hand of the cruel lords, and a mighty king shall rule over them, saith the Lord God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the waters of the sea shall fail, and the river shall be dried up, and wasted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rivers shall go far away: the rivers of defense shall be emptied and dried up: the reeds and flags shall be cut down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass in the river, and at the head of the rivers, and all that groweth by the river shall wither, and be driven away, and be no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fishers also shall mourn, and all they that cast angle into the river, shall lament, and they that spread their net upon the waters, shall be weakened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, they that work in flax of divers sorts, shall be confounded, and they that weave nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their nets shall be broken, and all they that make ponds shall be heavy in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the princes of Zoan are fools: the counsel of the wise counselors of Pharaoh, is become foolish: how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise? I am the son of the ancient kings?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where are now the wise men, that they may tell thee, or may know what the Lord of hosts hath determined against Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: The princes of Zoan are become fools: the princes of Noph are deceived, they have deceived Egypt, even the corners of the tribes thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath mingled among them the spirits of errors: and they have caused Egypt to err in every work thereof, as a drunken man erreth in his vomit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall there be any work in Egypt, which the head may do, nor the tail, the branch nor the rush.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall Egypt be like unto women: for it shall be afraid and fear because of the moving of the hand of the Lord of hosts, which he shaketh over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land of Judah shall be a fear unto Egypt: everyone that maketh mention of it, shall be afraid thereat, because of the counsel of the Lord of hosts, which he hath determined upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall five cities in the land of Egypt speak the language of Canaan, and shall swear by the Lord of hosts: one shall be called the city of destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the altar of the Lord be in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar by the border thereof unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto the Lord of hosts in the land of Egypt: for they shall cry unto the Lord, because of the oppressors, and he shall send them a Savior, and a great man, and shall deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall be known of the Egyptians, and the Egyptians shall know the Lord in that day, and do sacrifice and oblation, and shall vow vows unto the Lord, and perform them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord shall smite Egypt, he shall smite and heal it: for he shall return unto the Lord, and he shall be entreated of them and shall heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall there be a path from Egypt to Assyria, and Assyria shall come into Egypt, and Egypt into Assyria: so the Egyptians shall worship with Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and Assyria: even a blessing in the midst of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord of hosts shall bless it, saying, Blessed be my people Egypt and Assyria, the work of mine hands, and Israel mine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, (when Sargon king of Assyria sent him) and had fought against Ashdod, and taken it,
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time spake the Lord by the hand of Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, Go, and loose the sackcloth from thy loins, and put off thy shoe from thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years as a sign and wonder upon Egypt, and Ethiopia,
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the king of Assyria take away the captivity of Egypt, and the captivity of Ethiopia, both young men and old men, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fear, and be ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the inhabitants of this isle say in that day, Behold, such is our expectation, whither we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria, and how shall we be delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the desert sea. As the whirlwinds in the South used to pass from the wilderness, so shall it come from the horrible land.
speaker: Narrator

text: A grievous vision was showed unto me, The Transgressor against a transgressor, and the destroyer against a destroyer. Go up Elam, besiege Media: I have caused all the mourning thereof to cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore are my loins filled with sorrow: sorrows have taken me as the sorrows of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down when I heard it, and I was amazed when I saw it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine heart failed: fearfulness troubled me: the night of my pleasures hath he turned into fear unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare thou the table: watch in the watch tower: eat, drink: arise, ye princes, anoint the shield:
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, to tell what he seeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he saw a chariot with two horsemen: a chariot of an ass, and a chariot of a camel: and he hearkened and took diligent heed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried, A lion: my Lord, I stand continually upon the watch tower in the daytime, and I am set in my watch every night:
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, this man’s chariot cometh with two horsemen. And he answered and said, Babel is fallen: it is fallen, and all the images of her gods hath he broken unto the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor. That which I have heard of the Lord of hosts the God of Israel, have I showed unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Dumah, he calleth unto me out of Seir, Watchman, what was in the night? Watchman, what was in the night?
speaker: Narrator

text: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night. If ye will as he, inquire: return and come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden against Arabia. In the forest of Arabia shall ye tarry all night, even in the ways of Dedanites.
speaker: Narrator

text: O inhabitants of the land of Tema, bring forth water to meet the thirsty, and prevent him that fleeth with his bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they flee from the drawn swords, even from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Yet a year according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the residue of the number of the strong archers of the sons of Kedar shall be few: for the Lord God of Israel hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now that thou art wholly gone up unto the house tops?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou that art full of noise, a city full of brute, a joyous city, thy slain men shall not be slain with sword, nor die in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy princes shall flee together from the bow: they shall be bound: all that shall be found in thee, shall be bound together, which have fled from far.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore said I, Turn away from me, I will weep bitterly: labor not to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is a day of trouble, and of ruin, and of perplexity by the Lord God of hosts in the valley of vision, breaking down the city: and a crying unto the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elam bare the quiver in a man’s chariot with horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy chief valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array against the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he discovered the covering of Judah: and thou didst look in that day to the armor of the house of the forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye have seen the breaches of the city of David: for they were many, and ye gathered the waters of the lower pool.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses have ye broken down to fortify the wall,
speaker: Narrator

text: And have also made a ditch between the two walls, for the waters of the old pool, and have not looked unto the maker thereof, neither had respect unto him that formed it of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day did the Lord God of hosts call unto weeping and mourning, and to baldness and girding with sackcloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating flesh, and drinking wine, eating and drinking, for tomorrow we shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was declared in the ears of the Lord of hosts. Surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you, till ye die, saith the Lord God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord God of hosts, Go, get thee to that treasurer, to Shebna, the steward of the house, and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: What hast thou to do here? and whom hast thou here? that thou shouldest here hew thee out a sepulcher, as he that heweth out his sepulcher in a high place, or that graveth an habitation for himself in a rock?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord will carry thee away with a great captivity, and will surely cover thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will surely roll and turn thee like a ball in a large country: there shalt thou die, and there the chariots of thy glory shall be the shame of thy lord’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will drive thee from thy station, and out of thy dwelling will he destroy thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day will I call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And with thy garments will I clothe him, and with thy girdle will I strengthen him: thy power also will I commit into his hand, and he shall be a father of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and of the house of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder: so he shall open, and no man shall shut: and he shall shut, and no man shall open.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place, and he shall be for the throne of glory to his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father’s house, even of the nephews and posterity all small vessels, from the vessels of the cups, even to all the instruments of music.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day saith the Lord of hosts, shall the nail that is fastened in the sure place, depart and shall be broken and fall, and the burden that was upon it, shall be cut off: for the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of Tyre. Howl ye ships of Tarshish: for it is destroyed, so that there is none house: none shall come from the land of Kittim: it is revealed unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be still, ye that dwell in the isles: the merchants of Sidon, and such as pass over the sea, have replenished thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed of Nile growing by the abundance of waters, and the harvest of the river was her revenues, and she was a mart of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ashamed, thou Sidon: for the sea hath spoken, even the strength of the sea, saying, I have not travailed, nor brought forth children, neither nourished young men, nor brought up virgins.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the fame cometh to the Egyptians, they shall be sorry, concerning the rumor of Tyre.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go you over to Tarshish: howl, ye that dwell in the isles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this that your glorious city? her antiquity is of ancient days: her own feet shall lead her afar off to be a sojourner.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath decreed this against Tyre (that crowneth men) whose merchants are princes? whose chapmen are the nobles of the world?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord of hosts hath decreed this, to stain the pride of all glory, and to bring to contempt all them that be glorious in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pass through thy land like a flood to the daughter of Tarshish: there is no more strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out his hand upon the sea: he shook the kingdoms: the Lord hath given a commandment concerning the place of merchandise, to destroy the power thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice when thou art oppressed: O virgin daughter of Sidon: rise up, go out unto Kittim: yet there thou shalt have no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold the land of the Chaldeans: this was no people: Assyria founded it by the inhabitants of the wilderness: they set up the towers thereof: they raised the palaces thereof, and he brought it to ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howl ye ships of Tarshish, for your strength is destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall Tyre be forgotten seventy years (according to the years of one King) at the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take an harp and go about the city (thou harlot that hast been forgotten) make sweet melody, sing more songs that thou mayest be remembered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the end of seventy years shall the Lord visit Tyre, and she shall return to her wages, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the earth, that are in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet her occupying and her wages shall be holy unto the Lord: it shall not be laid up nor kept in store, but her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before the Lord, to eat sufficiently, and to have durable clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord maketh the earth empty, and he maketh it waste: he turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be like people, like Priest, and like servant, like master, like maid, like mistress, like buyer, like seller, like lender, like borrower, like giver, like taker to usury.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shall be clean emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the Lord hath spoken this word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth lamenteth and fadeth away, the world is feebled and decayed: the proud people of the earth are weakened.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth also deceiveth, because of the inhabitants thereof: for they transgressed the laws: they changed the ordinances, and brake the everlasting Covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are desolate. Wherefore the inhabitants of the land are burned up, and few men are left.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wine faileth, the vine hath no might: all that were of merry heart, do mourn.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth: the noise of them that rejoice, endeth: the joy of the harp ceaseth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not drink wine with mirth: strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city of vanity is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a crying for wine in the streets: all joy is darkened: the mirth of the world is gone away.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the cities is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely thus shall it be in the midst of the earth, among the people, as the shaking of an olive tree, and as the grapes when the vintage is ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall lift up their voice: they shall shout for the magnificence of the Lord: they shall rejoice from the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore praise ye the Lord in the valleys, even the Name of the Lord God of Israel, in the isles of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the uttermost part of the earth we have heard praises, even glory to the just, and I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe is me: the transgressors have offended: yea, the transgressors have grievously offended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear, and the pit, and the snare are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that fleeth from the noise of the fear, shall fall into the pit: and he that cometh up out of the pit, shall be taken in the snare: for the windows from on high are open, and the foundations of the earth do shake.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth is utterly broken down: the earth is clean dissolved: the earth is moved exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunken man, and shall be removed like a tent, and the iniquity thereof shall be heavy upon it: so that it shall fall, and rise no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall the Lord visit the host above that is on high, even the kings of the world that are upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be gathered together as the prisoners in the pit: and they shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the moon shall be abashed, and the sun ashamed, when the Lord of hosts shall reign in mount Zion and in Jerusalem: and glory shall be before his ancient men.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, thou art my God: I will exalt thee, I will praise thy Name: for thou hast done wonderful things, according to the counsels of old, with a stable truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast made of a city an heap, of a strong city, a ruin: even the place of strangers of a city, it shall never be built.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the mighty people give glory unto thee: the city of the strong nations shall fear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast been a strength unto the poor, even a strength to the needy in his trouble, a refuge against the tempest, a shadow against the heat: for the blast of the mighty is like a storm against the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt bring down the noise of the strangers, as the heat in a dry place; he will bring down the song of the mighty, as the heat in the shadow of a cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in this mountain shall the Lord of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, even a feast of fined wines, and of fat things full of marrow, of wines fined and purified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will destroy in this mountain the covering that covereth all people, and the veil that is spread upon all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will destroy death forever: and the Lord God will wipe away the tears from all faces, and the rebuke of his people will he take away out of all the earth: for the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall men say, Lo, this is our God: we have waited for him, and he will save us. This is the Lord, we have waited for him, we will rejoice and be joyful in salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this mountain shall the hand of the Lord rest, and Moab shall be threshed under him even as straw is threshed in Madmenah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall stretch out his hand in the midst of them (as he that swimmeth stretcheth them out to swim) and with the strength of his hands shall he bring down their pride.
speaker: Narrator

text: The defense also of the height of thy walls shall he bring down and lay low, and cast them to the ground, even unto the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah, We have a strong city: salvation shall God set for walls and bulwarks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Open ye the gates that the righteous nation, which keepeth the truth, may enter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: By an assured purpose wilt thou preserve perfect peace, because they trusted in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in the Lord forever: for in the Lord God is strength forevermore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he will bring down them that dwell on high: the high city he will abase: even unto the ground will he cast it down, and bring it unto dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
speaker: Narrator
