text: The way of the just is righteousness: thou wilt make equal the righteous path of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also we, O Lord, have waited for thee in the way of thy judgments: the desire of our soul is to thy Name, and to the remembrance of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: With my soul have I desired thee in the night, and with my spirit within me will I seek thee in the morning: for seeing thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world shall learn righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let mercy be showed to the wicked, yet he will not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he do wickedly, and will not behold the majesty of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, they will not behold thine high hand: but they shall see it, and be confounded with the zeal of the people, and the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord unto us thou wilt ordain peace: for thou also hast wrought all our works for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, other lords beside thee, have ruled us, but we will remember thee only, and thy Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead shall not live, neither shall the dead arise, because thou hast visited and scattered them, and destroyed all their memory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast increased the nation, O Lord: thou hast increased the nation: thou art made glorious, thou hast enlarged all the coasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lord, in trouble have they visited thee: they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near to the travail, is in sorrow, and crieth in her pains, so have we been in thy sight, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have conceived, we have born in pain, as though we should have brought forth wind: there was no help in the earth, neither did the inhabitants of the world fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy dead men shall live: even with my body shall they rise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, my people: enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors after thee: hide thyself for a very little while, until the indignation pass over.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, the Lord cometh out of his place, to visit the iniquity of the inhabitants of the earth upon them: and the earth shall disclose her blood, and shall no more hide her slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day the Lord with his sore and great and mighty sword shall visit Leviathan, that piercing serpent, even Leviathan, that crooked serpent, and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day sing of the vineyard of red wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: I the Lord do keep it: I will water it every moment: lest any assail it, I will keep it night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anger is not in me: who would set the briers and the thorns against me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or will he feel my strength, that he may make peace with me, and be at one with me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Hereafter Jacob shall take root: Israel shall flourish and grow: and the world shall be filled with fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that were slain by him?
speaker: Narrator

text: In measure in the branches thereof wilt thou contend with it, when he bloweth with his rough wind in the day of the East wind.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged, and this is all the fruit, the taking away of his sin: when he shall make all the stones of the altars, as chalk stones broken in pieces, that the groves and images may not stand up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the defensed city shall be desolate, and the habitation shall be forsaken, and left like a wilderness. There shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie and consume the branches thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the boughs of it are dry, they shall be broken: the women come and set them on fire: for it is a people of none understanding: therefore he that made them shall not have compassion of them, and he that formed them, shall have no mercy on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall the Lord thresh from the channel of the river unto the river of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered, one by one, O children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day also shall the great trumpet be blown, and they shall come, which perished in the land of Assyria, and they that were chased into the land of Egypt, and they shall worship the Lord in the holy Mount at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim: for his glorious beauty shall be a fading flower, which is upon the head of the valley of them that be fat, and are overcome with wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong host like a tempest of hail, and a whirlwind that overthroweth, like a tempest of mighty waters that overflow, which throw to the ground mightily.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be trodden under foot, even the crown and the pride of the drunkards of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his glorious beauty shall be a fading flower, which is upon the head of the valley of them that be fat, and as the hasty fruit afore Summer, which when he hath looketh upon it, seeth it, while it is in his hand, he eateth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty unto the residue of his people:
speaker: Narrator

text: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength unto them that turn away the battle to the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they have erred because of wine, and are out of the way by strong drink: the Priest and the prophet have erred by strong drink: they are swallowed up with wine: they have gone astray through strong drink: they fail in vision: they stumble in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all their tables are full of filthy vomiting: no place is clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand the things that he heareth? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept, line unto line, line unto line, there a little, and there a little.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with a stammering tongue, and with a strange language shall he speak unto this people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto whom he said, This is the rest: give rest unto him that is weary, and this is the refreshing, but they would not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall the word of the Lord be unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept, line unto line, line unto line, there a little and there a little: that they may go and fall backward, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore hear the word of the Lord, ye scornful men, that rule this people, which is at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement: though a scourge run over, and pass through, it shall not come at us: for we have made falsehood our refuge, and under vanity are we hid,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I will lay in Zion a stone, a tried stone, a precious cornerstone, a sure foundation. He that believeth, shall not make haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judgment also will I lay to the rule, and righteousness to the balance, and the hail shall sweep away the vain confidence, and the waters shall overflow the secret place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand: when a scourge shall run over and pass through, then shall ye be trodden down by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it passeth over, it shall take you away: for it shall pass through every morning in the day and in the night, and there shall be only fear, to make you to understand the hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bed is strait, that it cannot suffice, and the covering narrow, that one cannot wrap himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord shall stand as in mount Perazim: he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work, and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore be no mockers, lest your bonds increase: for I have heard of the Lord of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken ye, and hear my voice: hearken ye, and hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth the plowman plow all the day, to sow? doth he open, and break the clots of his ground?
speaker: Narrator

text: When he hath made it plain, will he not then sow the fitches, and sow cumin, and cast in wheat by measure, and the appointed barley and rye in their place?
speaker: Narrator

text: For his God doth instruct him to have discretion, and doth teach him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For fitches shall not be threshed with a threshing instrument, neither shall a cartwheel be turned about upon the cumin: but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and cumin with a rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bread corn when it is threshed, he doth not always thresh it, neither doth the wheel of his cart still make a noise, neither will he break it with the teeth thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also cometh from the Lord of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ah altar, altar of the city that David dwelt in: add year unto year: let them kill lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will bring the altar into distress, and there shall be heaviness and sorrow, and it shall be unto me like an altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will besiege thee as a circle, and fight against thee on a mount, and will cast up ramparts against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shalt thou be humbled, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be as out of the dust: thy voice also shall be out of the ground like him that hath a spirit of divination, and thy talking shall whisper out of the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, multitude of thy strangers shall be like small dust, and the multitude of strong men shall be as chaff that passeth away: and it shall be in a moment, even suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be visited of the Lord of hosts with thunder, and shaking, and a great noise, a whirlwind, and a tempest, and a flame of a devouring fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against the altar, shall be as a dream or vision by night: even all they that make the war against it, and strongholds against it, and lay siege unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be like as an hungry man dreameth, and behold, he eateth: and when he awaketh, his soul is empty: or like as a thirsty man dreameth, and lo, he is drinking, and when he awaketh, behold, he is faint, and his soul longeth: so shall the multitude of all nations be that fight against mount Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay yourselves and wonder: they are blind, and make you blind: they are drunken, but not with wine: they stagger, but not by strong drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath covered you with a spirit of slumber, and hath shut up your eyes: the Prophet, and your chief Seers hath he covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the vision of them all is become unto you, as the words of a book that is sealed up, which they deliver to one that can read, saying, Read this, I pray thee. Then shall he say, I cannot; for it is sealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the book is given unto him that cannot read, saying, Read this, I pray thee. And he shall say, I cannot read.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord said, Because this people come near unto me with their mouth, and honor me with their lips, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear toward me was taught by the precept of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore behold, I will again do a marvelous work in this people, even a marvelous work, and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the Lord: for their works are in darkness, and they say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Your turning of devices shall it not be esteemed as the potter’s clay? for shall the work say of him that made it, He made me not? or the thing formed, say of him that fashioned it, He had none understanding?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not yet but a little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into Carmel? and Carmel shall be counted as a forest?
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The meek in the Lord shall receive joy again, and the poor men shall rejoice in the Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cruel man shall cease, and the scornful shall be consumed: and all that hasted to iniquity, shall be cut off:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which made a man to sin in the word, and took him in a snare: which reproved them in the gate, and made the just to fall without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord unto the house of Jacob, even he that redeemed Abraham: Jacob shall not now be confounded, neither now shall his face be pale.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he seeth his children, the work of mine hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my Name, and sanctify the Holy one of Jacob, and shall fear the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they that erred in spirit, shall have understanding, and they that murmured, shall learn doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the Lord, that take counsel, but not of me, and cover with a covering, but not by my spirit, that they may lay sin upon sin:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which walk forth to go down into Egypt (and have not asked at my mouth) to strengthen themselves with the strength of Pharaoh, and trust in the shadow of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the strength of Pharaoh shall be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came unto Hanes.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be all ashamed of the people that cannot profit them, nor help, nor do them good, but shall be a shame and also a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The burden of the beasts of the South, in a land of trouble and anguish, from whence shall come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent against them that shall bear their riches upon the shoulders of the colts, and their treasures upon the bunches of the camels, to a people that cannot profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Egyptians are vanity, and they shall help in vain. Therefore have I cried unto her, Their strength is to sit still.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now go, and write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the last day forever and ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: That it is a rebellious people, lying children, and children that would not hear the Law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which say unto the Seers, See not: and to the Prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things: but speak flattering things unto us: prophesy errors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart out of the way: go aside out of the path: cause the Holy one of Israel to cease from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Holy one of Israel, Because you have cast off this word, and trust in violence, and wickedness, and stay thereupon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore this iniquity shall be unto you as a breach that falleth, or a swelling in an high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly in a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the breaking thereof is like the breaking of a potter’s pot, which is broken without pity, and in the breaking thereof is not found a shard to take fire out of the hearth, or to take water out of the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus said the Lord God, the Holy one of Israel, In rest and quietness shall ye be saved: in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength, but ye would not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have said, No, but we will flee away upon horses. Therefore shall ye flee. We will ride upon the swiftest. Therefore shall your persecutors be swifter.
speaker: Narrator

text: A thousand as one shall flee at the rebuke of one: at the rebuke of five shall ye flee, till ye be left as a ship mast upon the top of a mountain, and as a beacon upon an hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet therefore will the Lord wait, that he may have mercy upon you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have compassion upon you: for the Lord is the God of judgment. Blessed are all they that wait for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely a people shall dwell in Zion, and in Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will certainly have mercy upon thee at the voice of thy cry: when he heareth thee, he will answer thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord hath given you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, thy rain shall be no more kept back, but thine eyes shall see thy rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when thou turnest to the right hand, and when thou turnest to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall pollute the covering of the images of silver, and the rich ornament of thine images of gold, and cast them away as a menstruous cloth, and thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall he give rain unto thy seed, when thou shalt sow the ground, and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and as oil: in that day shall thy cattle be fed in large pastures.
speaker: Narrator

text: The oxen also and the young asses, that till the ground, shall eat clean provender, which is winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill shall there be rivers, and streams of waters, in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the light of the Moon shall be as the light of the Sun, and the light of the Sun shall be sevenfold, and like the light of seven days in the day that the Lord shall bind up the breach of his people, and heal the stroke of their wound.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Name of the Lord cometh from far, his face is burning, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his spirit is as a river that overfloweth up to the neck: it divideth asunder, to fan the nations with the fan of vanity, and there shall be a bridle to cause them to err in the jaws of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there shall be a song unto you as in the night, when a solemn feast is kept; and gladness of heart, as he that cometh with a pipe to go unto the mount of the Lord, to the Mighty one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall declare the lighting down of his arm with the anger of his countenance, and flame of a devouring fire, with scattering and tempest, and hailstones.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with the voice of the Lord shall Assyria be destroyed, which smote with the rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in every place that the staff shall pass, it shall cleave fast, which the Lord shall lay upon him with tabrets and beards and with battles, and lifting up of hands shall he fight against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Tophet is prepared of old; it is even prepared for the King; he hath made it deep and large: the burning thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the Lord, like a river of brimstone, doth kindle it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto them that go down into Egypt for help, and stay upon horses, and trust in chariots, because they are many, and in horsemen, because they be very strong; but they look not unto the Holy one of Israel, nor seek unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he yet is wisest; therefore he will bring evil, and not turn back his word, but he will arise against the house of the wicked, and against the help of them that work vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Egyptians are men and not God, and their horses flesh, and not spirit; and when the Lord shall stretch out his hand, the helper shall fall, and he that is helped shall fall, and they shall altogether fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this hath the Lord spoken unto me, As the lion or lion’s whelp roareth upon his prey, against whom if a multitude of shepherds be called, he will not be afraid at their voice, neither will humble himself at their noise: so shall the Lord of hosts come down to fight for mount Zion, and for the hill thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: As birds that fly, so shall the Lord of hosts defend Jerusalem by defending and delivering, by passing through and preserving it.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye children of Israel, turn again, in as much as ye are sunken deep in rebellion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in that day every man shall cast out his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your hands have made you, even a sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall Assyria fall by the sword, not of man, neither shall the sword of man devour him, and he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall go for fear to his tower, and his princes shall be afraid of the standard, saith the Lord, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, a King shall reign in justice, and the princes shall rule in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and as a refuge for the tempest, as rivers of water in a dry place, and as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the seeing shall not be shut, and the ears of them that hear, shall hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the heart of the foolish shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stutters shall be ready to speak distinctly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A niggard shall no more be called liberal, nor the churl rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the niggard will speak of niggardness, and his heart will work iniquity, and do wickedly, and speak falsely against the Lord, to make empty the hungry soul, and to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the weapons of the churl are wicked: he deviseth wicked counsels to undo the poor with lying words, and to speak against the poor in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the liberal man will devise of liberal things, and he will continue his liberality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up ye women that are at ease: hear my voice, ye careless daughters, hearken to my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye women that are careless, shall be in fear above a year in days, for the vintage shall fail, and the gatherings shall come no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye women that are at ease, be astonied; fear, O ye careless women: put off the clothes; make bare, and gird sackcloth upon the loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men shall lament for the teats, even for the pleasant fields, and for the fruitful vine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Upon the land of my people shall grow thorns and briers: yea, upon all the houses of joy in the city of rejoicing,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the palace shall be forsaken, and the noise of the city shall be left: the tower and fortress shall be dens forever, and the delight of wild asses, and a pasture for flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until the Spirit be poured upon us from above, and the wilderness become a fruitful field, and the plenteous field be counted as a forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And judgment shall dwell in the desert, and justice shall remain in the fruitful field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the work of justice shall be peace, even the work of justice and quietness, and assurance forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my people shall dwell in the tabernacle of peace, and in sure dwellings, and in safe resting places.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it haileth, it shall fall on the forest, and the city shall be in the low place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are ye that sow upon all waters, and drive thither the feet of the ox and the ass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to thee that spoilest, and wast not spoiled: and doest wickedly, and they did not wickedly against thee: when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled: when thou shalt make an end of doing wickedly, they shall do wickedly against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, have mercy upon us, we have waited for thee: be thou, which wast their arm in the morning, our help also in time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the noise of the tumult, the people fled: at thine exalting the nations were scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of caterpillars: and he shall go against him like the leaping of grasshoppers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is exalted: for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be stability of the times, strength, salvation, wisdom, and knowledge: for the fear of the Lord shall be his treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, their messengers shall cry without, and the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The paths are waste: the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant: he hath contemned the cities: he regardeth no man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The earth mourneth and fainteth: Lebanon is ashamed, and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness, and Bashan is shaken and Carmel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now will I arise, saith the Lord: now will I be exalted, now will I lift up myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall conceive chaff, and bring forth stubble: the fire of your breath shall devour you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people shall be as the burning of lime: and as the thorns cut up, shall they be burnt in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done, and ye that are near, know my power.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinners in Zion are afraid: a fear is come upon the hypocrites: who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with the everlasting burnings?
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walketh in justice, and speaketh righteous things, refusing gain of oppression, shaking his hands from taking of gifts, stopping his ears from hearing of blood, and shutting his eyes from seeing evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall dwell on high: his defense shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him, and his waters shall be sure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes shall see the King in his glory: they shall behold the land far off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine heart shall meditate fear, Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a dark speech, that thou canst not perceive, and of a stammering tongue that thou canst not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look upon Zion the city of our solemn feasts: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that cannot be removed: and the stakes thereof can never be taken away, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For surely there the mighty Lord will be unto us, as a place of floods, and broad rivers, whereby shall pass no ship with oars, neither shall great ship pass thereby.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord is our Judge, the Lord is our lawgiver: the Lord is our King, he will save us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy cords are loosed: they could not well strengthen their mast, neither could they spread the sail: then shall the prey be divided for a great spoil: yea, the lame shall take away the prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And none inhabitant shall say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein, shall have their iniquity forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come near, ye nations and hear, and hearken, ye people: let the earth hear and all that is therein, the world and all that proceedeth thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the indignation of the Lord is upon all nations, and his wrath upon all their armies: he hath destroyed them and delivered them to the slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their slain shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up out of their bodies, and the mountains shall be melted with their blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens shall be folded like a book: and all their hosts shall fall as the leaf falleth from the vine, and as it falleth from the fig tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my sword shall be drunken in the heaven: behold, it shall come down upon Edom, even upon the people of my curse to judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sword of the Lord is filled with blood: it is made fat with the fat and with the blood of the lambs and the goats, with the fat of the kidneys of the rams: for the Lord hath a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the unicorn shall come down with them, and the heifers with the bulls, and their land shall be drunken with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is the day of the Lord’s vengeance, and the year of recompense for the judgment of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rivers thereof shall be turned into pitch, and the dust thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall be burning pitch.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be quenched night nor day: the smoke thereof shall go up evermore: it shall be desolate from generation to generation; none shall pass through it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the pelican and the hedgehog shall possess it, and the great owl, and the raven shall dwell in it, and he shall stretch out upon it the line of vanity, and the stones of emptiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The nobles thereof shall call to the kingdom, and there shall be none, and all the princes thereof shall be as nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall bring forth thorns in the palaces thereof, nettles, and thistles in the strongholds thereof, and it shall be an habitation for dragons, and a court for ostriches.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall meet also Ziim and Iim, and the Satyr shall cry to his fellow, and the screech owl shall rest there, and shall find for herself a quiet dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall the owl make her nest, and lay and hatch, and gather them under her shadow: there shall the vultures also be gathered, every one with her make.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek in the book of the Lord, and read: none of these shall fail, none shall want her make: for his mouth hath commanded, and his very spirit hath gathered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath cast the lot for them, and his hand hath divided unto them by line: they shall possess it forever: from generation to generation shall they dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desert and the wilderness shall rejoice, and the waste ground shall be glad and flourish as the rose.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall flourish abundantly, and shall greatly rejoice also and joy: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it: the beauty of Carmel, and of Sharon, they shall see the glory of the Lord, and the excellency of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strengthen the weak hands, and comfort the feeble knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto them that are fearful, Be you strong, fear not: behold, your God cometh with vengeance: even God with a recompense, he will come and save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the eyes of the blind be lightened, and the ears of the deaf be opened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the dumb man’s tongue shall sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and rivers in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the dry ground shall be as a pool, and the thirsty as springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where they lay, shall be a place for reeds and rushes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a path and a way, and the way shall be called holy: the polluted shall not pass by it: for he shall be with them, and walk in the way, and the fools shall not err.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be no lion, nor noisome beasts shall ascend by it, neither shall they be found there, that the redeemed may walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the redeemed of the Lord shall return and come to Zion with praise: and everlasting joy shall be upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib King of Assyria came up against all the strong cities of Judah, and took them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish toward Jerusalem unto king Hezekiah, with a great host, and he stood by the conduit of the upper pool in the path of the fuller’s field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came forth unto him Eliakim the son of Hilkiah the steward of the house, and Shebna the chancellor, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rabshakeh said unto them, Tell you Hezekiah, I pray you, Thus saith the great king, the King of Assyria, What confidence is this, wherein thou trustest?
speaker: Narrator

text: I say, Surely I have eloquence, but counsel and strength are for the war: on whom then dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Lo, thou trustest in this broken staff of reed, on Egypt, whereupon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh King of Egypt unto all that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou say unto me, We trust in the Lord our God, is not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah took down, and said to Judah and to Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore give hostages to my Lord the king of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For how canst thou despise any captain of the least of my lord’s servants? and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
speaker: Narrator

text: And am I now come up without the Lord to this land to destroy it? The Lord said unto me, Go up against this land and destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Eliakim, and Shebna and Joah unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Aramite’s language (for we understand it) and talk not with us in the Jews’ tongue, in the audience of the people that are on the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Rabshakeh, Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words, and not to the men that sit on the wall? that they may eat their own thing, and drink their own piss with you?
speaker: Narrator

text: So Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language, and said, Hear the words of the great King, of the King of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither let Hezekiah make you to trust in the Lord, saying, The Lord will surely deliver us: this city shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make appointment with me, and come out to me, that every man may eat of his own vine, and every man of his own fig tree, and drink every man the water of his own well,
speaker: Narrator

text: Till I come and bring you to a land like your own land, even a land of wheat and wine, a land of bread and vineyards,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest Hezekiah deceive you, saying, The Lord will deliver us. Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the god of Hamath, and of Arpad? where is the god of Sepharvaim? or how have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is he among all the gods of these lands, that hath delivered their country out of mine hand, that the Lord should deliver Jerusalem out of mine hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they kept silence, and answered him not a word: for the king’s commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah the steward of the house, and Shebna the chancellor, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, unto Hezekiah with rent clothes, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the King Hezekiah heard it, he rent his clothes, and put on sackcloth and came into the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent Eliakim the steward of the house, and Shebna the chancellor, with the Elders of the Priests, clothed in sackcloth unto Isaiah the Prophet the son of Amoz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of tribulation and of rebuke and blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is no strength to bring forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If so be the Lord thy God hath heard the words of Rabshakeh, whom the King of Assyria his master hath sent to rail on the living God, and to reproach him with words, which the Lord thy God hath heard, then lift thou up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the servants of the King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus say unto your master, Thus saith the Lord, Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the King of Assyria have blasphemed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a noise, and return to his own land, and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the King of Assyria fighting against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: He heard also men say of Tirhakah, King of Ethiopia, Behold, he is come out to fight against thee: and when he heard it, he sent other messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah King of Judah, saying, Let not thy God deceive thee, in whom thou trustest, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the King of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou hast heard what the Kings of Assyria have done to all lands in destroying them, and shalt thou be delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed? as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden, which were at Telassar?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the King of Arpad, and the King of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it, and he went up into the house of the Lord, and Hezekiah spread it before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah prayed unto the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, which dwellest between the Cherubims, thou art very God alone over all the kingdoms of the earth: thou hast made the heaven and the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear: open thine eyes, O Lord, and see, and hear all the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent to blaspheme the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truth it is, O Lord, that the Kings of Assyria have destroyed all lands and their country,
speaker: Narrator

text: And have cast their gods in the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men’s hands, even wood or stone: therefore they destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O Lord our God, save thou us out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know, that thou only art the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Because thou hast prayed unto me, concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria,
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the word that the Lord hath spoken against him, The virgin, the daughter of Zion, hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn: the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom hast thou railed on and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: By thy servants hast thou railed on the Lord, and said, By the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the top of the mountains to the sides of Lebanon, and will cut down the high cedars thereof, and the fair fir trees thereof, and I will go up to the heights of his top, and to the forest of his fruitful places.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have dug, and drunk the waters, and with the plant of my feet have I dried all the rivers closed in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hast thou not heard how I have of old time made it, and have formed it long ago? and should I now bring it, that it should be destroyed, and laid on ruinous heaps, as cities defensed?
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose inhabitants have small power, and are afraid and confounded: they are like the grass of the field and green herb, or grass on the house tops, or corn blasted afore it be grown.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know thy dwelling, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy fury against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou ragest against me, and thy tumult is come unto mine ears, therefore will I put mine hook in thy nostrils, and my bridle in thy lips, and will bring thee back again the same way thou camest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be a sign unto thee, O Hezekiah, Thou shalt eat this year such as groweth of itself: and the second year such things as grow without sowing: and in the third year, sow ye and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah, shall again take root downward and bear fruit upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the Lord of hosts shall do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning the King of Assyria, He shall not enter into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a mount against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the same way that he came, he shall return, and not come into this city, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will defend this city to save it, for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Angel of the Lord went out, and smote in the camp of Assyria, an hundred fourscore, and five thousand: so when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went away and returned and dwelt at Nineveh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he was in the Temple worshipping of Nisroch his god, Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons slew him with the sword, and they escaped into the land of Ararat: and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: About that time was Hezekiah sick unto the death, and the Prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Put thine house in an order, for thou shalt die, and not live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall, and prayed to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, I beseech thee, Lord, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth, and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight: and Hezekiah wept sore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go, and say unto Hezekiah, Thus saith the Lord God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, and seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and this city: for I will defend this city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this sign shalt thou have of the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees (whereby it is gone down in the dial of Ahaz by the sun) ten degrees backward: so the sun returned by ten degrees, by the which degrees it was gone down.
speaker: Narrator

text: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said, I shall not see the Lord, even the Lord in the land of the living: I shall see man no more among the inhabitants of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mine habitation is departed, and is removed from me, like a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off from the height: from day to night, thou wilt make an end of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I reckoned to the morning: but he brake all my bones like a lion, from day to night wilt thou make an end of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes were lifted up on high: O Lord, it hath oppressed me, comfort me.
speaker: Narrator

text: What shall I say, for he hath said it to me, and he hath done it: I shall walk weakly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, to them that overlive them, and to all that are in them, the life of my spirit shall be known, that thou causest me to sleep and hast given life to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, for felicity I had bitter grief, but it was thy pleasure to deliver my soul from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the grave cannot confess thee: death cannot praise thee: they that go down into the pit, cannot hope for thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the living, the living, he shall confess thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall declare thy truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my song, all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Isaiah, Take a lump of dry figs and lay it upon the boil, and he shall recover.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Hezekiah had said, What is the sign, that I shall go up into the house of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time, Merodach Baladan, the son of Baladan, King of Babel, sent letters, and a present to Hezekiah: for he had heard that he had been sick, and was recovered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hezekiah was glad of them, and showed them the house of the treasures, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures; there was nothing in his house, nor in all his kingdom that Hezekiah showed them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Isaiah the Prophet unto King Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they to thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me, from Babel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All that is in mine house have they seen; there is nothing among my treasures, that I have not showed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the Lord of hosts,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and which thy fathers have laid up in store until this day, shall be carried to Babel: nothing shall be left, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of thy sons, that shall proceed out of thee, and which thou shalt beget, shall they take away, and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the King of Babel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, The word of the Lord is good, which thou hast spoken: and he said, Yet let there be peace, and truth in my days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, will your God say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned; for she hath received of the Lord’s hand double for all her sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord: make straight in the desert a path for our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low; and the crooked shall be straight, and the rough places plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh is grass, and all the grace thereof is as the flowers of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth, because the Spirit of the Lord bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain: O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength: lift it up, be not afraid: say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord God will come with power, and his arm shall rule for him: behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall guide them with young.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath measured the waters in his fist? and counted heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure? and weighed the mountains in a weight, and the hills in a balance?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath instructed the spirit of the Lord? or was his counselor, or taught him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Of whom took the counsel, and who instructed him and taught him in the way of judgment? or taught him knowledge, and showed unto him the way of understanding?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the dust of the balance: behold, he taketh away the isles as a little dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lebanon is not sufficient for fire, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for a burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: All nations before him are as nothing, and they are counted to him, less than nothing, and vanity.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom then will ye liken God? or what similitude will ye set up unto him?
speaker: Narrator

text: The workman melteth an image, or the goldsmith beateth it out in gold, or the goldsmith maketh silver plates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth not the poor choose out a tree that will not rot, for an oblation? he seeketh also unto him a cunning workman, to prepare an image that shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye nothing? have ye not heard it? hath it not been told you from the beginning? have ye not understood it by the foundation of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: He sitteth upon the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers, he stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out, as a tent to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bringeth the princes to nothing, and maketh the judges of the earth, as vanity,
speaker: Narrator

text: As though they were not planted, as though they were not sown, as though their stock took no root in the earth: for he did even blow upon them, and they withered, and the whirlwind will take them away as stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom now will ye liken me, that I should be like him, saith the Holy one?
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your eyes on high, and behold who hath created these things, and bringeth out their armies by number, and calleth them all by names: by the greatness of his power and mighty strength nothing faileth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest O Israel, My way is hid from the Lord, and my judgment is passed over of my God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowest thou not? or hast thou not heard, that the everlasting God, the Lord hath created the ends of the earth? he neither fainteth, nor is weary: there is no searching of his understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he giveth strength unto him that fainteth, and unto him that hath no strength, he increaseth power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the young men shall faint, and be weary, and the young men shall stumble and fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they that wait upon the Lord, shall renew their strength: they shall lift up the wings, as the eagles: they shall run, and not be weary, and they shall walk and not faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep silence before me, O islands, and let the people renew their strength: let them come near, and let them speak: let us come together into judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who raised up justice from the East, and called him to his foot? and gave the nations before him, and subdued the kings? he gave them as dust to his sword, and as scattered stubble unto his bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He pursued them, and passed safely by the way that he had not gone with his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath wrought and done it? he that calleth the generations from the beginning. I the Lord am the first, and with the last I am the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: The isles saw it, and did fear, and the ends of the earth were abashed, drew near, and came.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man helped his neighbor, and said to his brother, Be strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the workman comforted the founder, and he that smote with the hammer, him that smote by course, saying, It is ready for the soldering, and he fastened it with nails that it should not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, Israel, art my servant, and thou Jacob, whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have taken thee from the ends of the earth, and called thee before the chief thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant: I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear thou not, for I am with thee: be not afraid, for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee, and help thee, and will sustain thee with the right hand of my justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all they that provoke thee, shall be ashamed, and confounded: they shall be as nothing, and they that strive with thee shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt seek them and shalt not find them: to wit, the men of thy strife, for they shall be as nothing, and the men that war against thee, as a thing of nought.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not, I will help thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not thou worm, Jacob, and ye men of Israel: I will help thee, saith the Lord, and thy redeemer the holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will make thee a roller, and a new threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and bring them to powder, and shalt make the hills as chaff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the Lord, and shalt glory in the holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the poor and the needy seek water, and there is none (their tongue faileth for thirst: I the Lord will hear them: I the God of Israel will not forsake them:)
speaker: Narrator

text: I will open rivers in the tops of the hills, and fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness as a pool of water, and the waste land as springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will set in the wilderness the cedar, the Shittah, and the myrrhe tree, and the pine tree, and I will set in the wilderness the fir tree, the elm and the box tree together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore let them see and know, and let them consider and understand together that the hand of the Lord hath done this, and the holy One of Israel hath created it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand to your cause, saith the Lord: bring forth your strong reasons saith the King of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them bring them forth, and let them tell us what shall come, let them show the former things what they be, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them: either declare us things for to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye are gods: yea, do good or do evil, that we may declare it, and behold it together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye are of no value, and your making is of naught: man hath chosen an abomination by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have raised up from the North, and he shall come: from the East sun shall he call upon my name, and shall come upon princes as upon clay, and as the potter treadeth mire under the foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? or before time, that we may say, He is righteous? Surely there is none that showeth: surely there is none that declareth: surely there is none that heareth your words.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the first, that saith to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that shall bring good tidings.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I beheld, there was none: and when I inquired of them, there was no counselor, and when I demanded of them, they answered not a word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they are all vanity: their work is of nothing, their images are wind and confusion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, my servant: I will stay upon him: mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth: I have put my Spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not fail nor be discouraged till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith God the Lord (he that created the heavens and spread them abroad: he that stretched forth the earth, and the buds thereof: he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein)
speaker: Narrator

text: I the Lord have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and I will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, and for a light of the Gentiles,
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou mayest open the eyes of the blind, and bring out the prisoners from the prison: and them that sit in darkness, out of the prison house.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord, this is my Name, and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they come forth, I tell you of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sing unto the Lord a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth: ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein, the isles and the inhabitants thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the towns that Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rocks sing: let them shout from the top of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them give glory unto the Lord, and declare his praise in the islands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall go forth as a giant; he shall stir up his courage like a man of war: he shall shout and cry, and shall prevail against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have a long time held my peace: I have been still and refrained myself; now will I cry like a travailing woman: I will destroy and devour at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make waste mountains, and hills, and dry up all their herbs, and I will make the floods islands, and I will dry up the pools.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring the blind by a way, that they knew not, and lead them by paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be turned back: they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, and say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, ye deaf: and ye blind, regard, that ye may see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is blind but my servant? or deaf as my messenger, that I sent? who is blind as the perfect, and blind as the Lord’s servant?
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing many things, but thou keepest them not? opening the ears, but he heareth not?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is willing for his righteousness sake, that he may magnify the Law and exalt it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this people is robbed and spoiled, and shall be all snared in dungeons, and they shall be hid in prison houses; they shall be for prey, and none shall deliver: a spoil, and none shall say, Restore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who among you shall hearken to this, and take heed, and hear for afterwards?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? Did not the Lord, because we have sinned against him? for they would not walk in his ways, neither be obedient unto his Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he hath poured upon him his fierce wrath, and the strength of battle; and it set him on fire round about, and he knew not, and it burned him up, yet he considered not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now thus saith the Lord, that created thee, O Jacob: and he that formed thee, O Israel, Fear not: for I have redeemed thee: I have called thee by thy name, thou art mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee, and through the floods, that they do not overflow thee. When thou walkest through the very fire, thou shalt not be burnt, neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am the Lord thy God, the holy one of Israel, thy Savior: I gave Egypt for thy ransom, Ethiopia, and Seba for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou wast precious in my sight, and thou wast honorable, and I loved thee, therefore will I give man for thee, and people for thy sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not, for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the East, and gather thee from the West.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say to the North, Give: and to the South, Keep not back: bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone shall be called by my Name: for I created him for my glory, formed him and made him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will bring forth the blind people, and they shall have eyes, and the deaf, and they shall have ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the people be assembled: who among them can declare this, and show us former things? let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: but let them hear, and say, It is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my witnesses, saith the Lord, and my servant, whom I have chosen: therefore ye shall know and believe me, and ye shall understand that I am: before me there was no God formed, neither shall there be after me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I am the Lord, and beside me there is no Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared, and I have saved, and I have showed, when there was no strange god among you: therefore you are my witnesses, saith the Lord, that I am God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, before the day was, I am, and there is none that can deliver out of mine hand: I will do it, and who shall let it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord your redeemer, the holy one of Israel, For your sake I have sent to Babel, and brought it down: they are all fugitives, and the Chaldeans cry in the ships.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord your holy one, the creator of Israel, your King.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord which maketh a way in the Sea, and a path in the mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he bringeth out the chariot and horse, the army and the power lie together, and shall not rise, they are extinct, and quenched as tow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember ye not the former things, neither regard the things of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I do a new thing: now shall it come forth: shall you not know it? I will even make a way in the desert, and floods in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wild beasts shall honor me, the dragons and the ostriches, because I gave water in the desert, and floods in the wilderness to give drink to my people, even to mine elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: This people have I formed for myself: they shall show forth my praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob, but thou hast wearied me, O Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast not brought me the sheep of thy burnt offerings, neither hast thou honored me with thy sacrifices. I have not caused thee to serve with an offering, nor wearied thee with incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou broughtest me no sweet savor with money, neither hast thou made me drunk with the fat of thy sacrifices, but thou hast made me to serve with thy sins, and wearied me with thine iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I am he that putteth away thine iniquities for mine own sake, and will not remember thy sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put me in remembrance: let us be judged together: count thou that thou mayest be justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have profaned the rulers of the Sanctuary, and have made Jacob a curse, and Israel a reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant, and Israel whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, that made thee, and formed thee from the womb: he will help thee. Fear not, O Jacob, my servant, and thou righteous whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will pour water upon the thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thy buds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall grow as among the grass, and as the willows by the rivers of waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: One shall say, I am the Lord’s: another shall be called by the name of Jacob: and another shall subscribe with his hand unto the Lord, and name himself by the name of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord the King of Israel and his redeemer, the Lord of hosts, I am the first, and I am the last, and without me is there no God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is like me, that shall call and shall declare it, and set it in order before me, since I appointed the ancient people? and what is at hand, and what things are to come? let them show unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear ye not, neither be afraid: have not I told thee of old, and have declared it? you are even my witnesses, whether there be a God beside me, and that there is no God that I know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they that make an image, are vanity, and their delectable things shall nothing profit: and they are their own witnesses, that they see not nor know: therefore they shall be confounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath made a god, or molten an image, that is profitable for nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all that are of the fellowship thereof, shall be confounded: for the workmen themselves are men: let them all be gathered together, and stand up, yet they shall fear, and be confounded together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The smith taketh an instrument, and worketh in the coals, and fashioneth it with hammers, and worketh it with the strength of his arms, yea, he is an hungered, and his strength faileth, he drinketh no water, and is faint.
speaker: Narrator

text: The carpenter stretcheth forth a line, he fashioneth it with a red thread, he planeth it, and he portrayeth it with the compass, and maketh it after the figure of a man, and according to the beauty of a man, that it may remain in an house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will hew him down cedars, and take the pine tree and the oak, and taketh courage among the trees of the forest; he planteth a fir tree, and the rain doth nourish it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And man burneth thereof; for he will take thereof, and warm himself: he also kindleth it, and baketh bread, yet he maketh a god, and worshippeth it; he maketh it an idol, and boweth unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He burneth the half thereof even in the fire, and upon the half thereof he eateth flesh; he roasteth the roast, and is satisfied; also he warmeth himself and saith, Aha, I am warm, I have been at the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the residue thereof he maketh a god, even his idol; he boweth unto it, and worshippeth and prayeth unto it, and saith, Deliver me; for thou art my god.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have not known, nor understood: for God hath shut their eyes that they cannot see, and their heart, that they cannot understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And none considereth in his heart, neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say, I have burnt half of it, even in the fire, and have baked bread also upon the coals thereof: I have roasted flesh, and eaten it, and shall I make the residue thereof an abomination? shall I bow to the stock of a tree?
speaker: Narrator

text: He feedeth of ashes: a seduced heart hath deceived him, that he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember these (O Jacob and Israel) for thou art my servant: I have formed thee; thou art my servant: O Israel forget me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have put away thy transgressions like a cloud, and thy sins as a mist; turn unto me, for I have redeemed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice ye heavens; for the Lord hath done it; shout, ye lower parts of the earth; burst forth into praises, ye mountains, O forest and every tree therein: for the Lord hath redeemed Jacob, and will be glorified in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb, I am the Lord that made all things, that spread out the heavens alone, and stretched out the earth by myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: I destroy the tokens of the soothsayers, and make them that conjecture, fools, and turn the wise men backward, and make their knowledge foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He confirmeth the word of his servant, and performeth the counsel of his messengers, saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited: and to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be built up, and I will repair the decayed places thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saith to the deep, Be dry, and I will dry up thy floods.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saith to Cyrus, Thou art my shepherd, and he shall perform all my desire: saying also to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built, and to the Temple, Thy foundation shall be surely laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord unto Cyrus his anointed, whose right hand I have holden to subdue nations before him: therefore will I weaken the loins of kings, and open the doors before him, and the gates shall not be shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will go before thee, and make the crooked straight: I will break the brazen doors, and burst the iron bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give thee the treasures of darkness, and the things hid in secret places, that thou mayest know that I am the Lord which call thee by thy name, even the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Jacob my servant’s sake, and Israel mine elect, I will even call thee by thy name, and name thee, though thou hast not known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord, and there is none other; there is no God besides me: I girded thee, though thou hast not known me.
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the West, that there is none besides me. I am the Lord, and there is none other.
speaker: Narrator

text: I form the light, and create darkness: I make peace, and create evil: I the Lord do all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye heavens send the dew from above, and let the clouds drop down righteousness: let the earth open, and let salvation and justice grow forth: let it bring them forth together: I the Lord have created him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe be unto him that striveth with his maker, the potsherd with the potsherds of the earth: shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, What makest thou? or thy work, It hath none hands?
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto him that saith to his father, What hast thou begotten? or to his mother, What hast thou brought forth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, the only one of Israel, and his maker, Ask me of things to come concerning my sons, and concerning the works of mine hands: commend you me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made the earth, and created man upon it: I, whose hands have spread out the heavens, I have even commanded all their army.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have raised him up in righteousness, and I will direct all his ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let go my captives, not for price nor reward, saith the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, The labor of Egypt, and the merchandise of Ethiopia, and of the Sabeans, men of stature shall come unto thee, and they shall be thine: they shall follow thee, and shall go in chains: they shall fall down before thee, and make supplication unto thee, saying, Surely God is in thee, and there is none other God besides.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily, thou O God hidest thyself, O God, the Savior of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: All they shall be ashamed and also confounded: they shall go to confusion together, that are the makers of images.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Israel shall be saved in the Lord, with an everlasting salvation: ye shall not be ashamed nor confounded world without end.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this saith the Lord (that created heaven, God himself that formed the earth, and made it: he that prepared it, he created it not in vain: he formed it to be inhabited) I am the Lord, and there is none other.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not spoken in secret, neither in a place of darkness in the earth: I said not in vain unto the seed of Jacob, Seek you me: I the Lord do speak righteousness, and declare righteous things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble yourselves, and come: draw near together, ye abject of the Gentiles: they have no knowledge, that set up the wood of their idol, and pray unto a god, that cannot save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell ye and bring them, and let them take counsel together, who hath declared this from the beginning, or hath told it of old? Have not I the Lord? and there is none other God beside me, a just God, and a Savior: there is none beside me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look unto me, and ye shall be saved: all the ends of the earth shall be saved: for I am God, and there is none other.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sworn by myself: the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness, and shall not return, That every knee shall bow unto me, and every tongue shall swear by me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely he shall say, In the Lord have I righteousness and strength: he shall come unto him, and all that provoke him shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole seed of Israel shall be justified, and glory in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bel is bowed down: Nebo is fallen: their idols were upon their beasts, and upon the cattle: they which did bear you, were laden with a weary burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are bowed down, and fallen together, for they could not rid them of the burden, and their soul is gone into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye me, O house of Jacob, and all that remain of the house of Israel, which are born of me from the womb, and brought up of me from the birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore unto old age, I the same, even I will bear you until the hoary hairs: I have made you: I will also bear you, and I will carry you, and I will deliver you.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom will ye make me like, or make me equal, or compare me that I should be like him?
speaker: Narrator

text: They draw gold out of the bag, and weigh silver in the balance, and hire a goldsmith to make a god of it, and they bow down and worship it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They bear it upon the shoulders: they carry him and set him in his place: so doth he stand, and cannot remove from his place. Though one cry unto him, yet can he not answer, nor deliver him out of his tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this, and be ashamed: bring it again to mind, O you transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none other God, and there is nothing like me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which declare the last thing from the beginning, and from of old: the things that were not done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do whatsoever I will.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call a bird from the East, and the man of my counsel from far: as I have spoken, so will I bring it to pass: I have purposed it, and I will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me ye stubborn hearted, that are far from justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: I bring near my justice: it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not tarry: for I will give salvation in Zion, and my glory unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator
