text: Come down and sit in the dust: O virgin, daughter Babel, sit on the ground: there is no throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for thou shalt no more be called, Tender and delicate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the millstones, and grind meal; loose thy locks: make bare the feet: uncover the leg, and pass through the floods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy filthiness shall be discovered, and thy shame shall be seen: I will take vengeance, and I will not meet thee as a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our redeemer, the Lord of hosts is his Name, the holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sit still, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for thou shalt no more be called, The lady of kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was wroth with my people: I have polluted mine inheritance, and given them into thine hand, thou didst show them no mercy, but thou didst lay thy very heavy yoke upon the ancient.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou saidest, I shall be a lady forever, so that thou didst not set thy mind to these things, neither didst thou remember the latter end thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now hear, thou that art given to pleasures, and dwellest careless, She saith in her heart, I am and none else: I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall know the loss of children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these two things shall come to thee suddenly on one day, the loss of children and widowhood; they shall come upon thee in their perfection, for the multitude of thy divinations, and for the great abundance of thine enchanters.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness; thou hast said, None seeth me. Thy wisdom and thy knowledge, they have caused thee to rebel, and thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and none else.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall evil come upon thee, and thou shalt not know the morning thereof; destruction shall fall upon thee, which thou shalt not be able to put away: destruction shall come upon thee suddenly, or thou beware.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand now among thine enchanters, and in the multitude of thy soothsayers (with whom thou hast wearied thyself from thy youth) if so be thou mayest have profit, or if so be thou mayest have strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels: let now the astrologers, the stargazers, and prognosticators stand up, and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, they shall be as stubble: the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver their own lives from the power of the flame: there shall be no coals to warm at, nor light to sit by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall they serve thee, with whom thou hast wearied thee, even thy merchants from thy youth; every one shall wander to his own quarters: none shall save thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob, which are called by the name of Israel, and are come out of the waters of Judah: which swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, but not in truth nor in righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are called of the holy city, and stay themselves upon the God of Israel, whose Name is the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have declared the former things of old, and they went out of my mouth, and I showed them: I did them suddenly and they came to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I have declared it to thee of old: before it came to pass, I showed it thee, lest thou shouldest say, Mine idol hath done them, and my carved image, and my molten image hath commanded them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast heard, behold all this, and will not ye declare it? I have showed thee new things, even now, and hid things, which thou knewest not.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are created now, and not of old, and even before this thou heardest them not, lest thou shouldest say, Behold, I knew them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou heardest them not, neither didst know them, neither yet was thine ear opened of old; for I knew that thou wouldest grievously transgress: therefore have I called thee a transgressor from the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my Name’s sake will I defer my wrath, and for my praise, will I refrain it from thee, that I cut thee not off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have fined thee, but not as silver: I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine own sake, for mine own sake will I do it; for how should my Name be polluted? surely I will not give my glory unto another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me, O Jacob and Israel, my called, I am, I am the first, and I am the last.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely mine hand hath laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand hath spanned the heavens: when I call them, they stand up together.
speaker: Narrator

text: All you, assemble yourselves, and hear: which among them hath declared these things? The Lord hath loved him, he will do his will in Babel, and his arm shall be against the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I have spoken it, and I have called him, I have brought him, and his way shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come near unto me: hear ye this: I have not spoken it in secret from the beginning: from the time that the thing was, I was there, and now the Lord God and his Spirit hath sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord thy redeemer, the Holy one of Israel, I am the Lord thy God, which teach thee to profit, and lead thee by the way that thou shouldest go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh, that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! then had thy prosperity been as the flood, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy seed also had been as the sand, and the fruit of thy body like the gravel thereof: his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go ye out of Babel: flee ye from the Chaldeans with a voice of joy: tell and declare this: show it forth to the end of the earth: say ye, The Lord hath redeemed his servant Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were not thirsty: he led them through the wilderness: he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them: for he clave the rock and the water gushed out.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no peace, saith the Lord, unto the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye me, O isles, and hearken, ye people from far. The Lord hath called me from the womb, and made mention of my name from my mother’s belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword: under the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a chosen shaft, and hid me in his quiver,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto me, Thou art my servant Israel, for I will be glorious in thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said, I have labored in vain: I have spent my strength in vain and for nothing; but my judgment is with the Lord, and my work with my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now saith the Lord that formed me from the womb to be his servant, that I may bring Jacob again to him (though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the Lord; and my God shall be my strength.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, It is a small thing that thou shouldest be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the desolations of Israel: I will also give thee for a light of the Gentiles, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord the redeemer of Israel, and his holy One, to him that is despised in soul, to a nation that is abhorred, to a servant of rulers, Kings shall see, and arise, and princes shall worship, because of the Lord, that is faithful: and the holy One of Israel, which hath chosen thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and will give thee for a covenant of the people, that thou mayest raise up the earth, and obtain the inheritance of the desolate heritages:
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou mayest say to the prisoners, Go forth; and to them that are in darkness, Show yourselves; they shall feed in the ways, and their pastures shall be in all the tops of the hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not be hungry, neither shall they be thirsty, neither shall the heat smite them, nor the sun, for he that hath compassion on them, shall lead them; even to the springs of water shall he drive them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make all my mountains, as a way, and my paths shall be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, these shall come from far: and lo, these from the North and from the West, and these from the land of Sinim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; burst forth into praise, O mountains; for God hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zion said, The Lord hath forsaken me, and my Lord hath forgotten me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can a woman forget her child, and not have compassion on the son of her womb? though they should forget, yet will I not forget thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have graven thee upon the palm of mine hands: thy walls are ever in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy builders make haste: thy destroyers and they that made thee waste, are departed from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thine eyes round about and behold: all these gather themselves together and come to thee: as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely put them all upon thee as a garment, and gird thyself with them like a bride.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thy desolations, and thy waste places, and thy land destroyed, shall surely be now narrow for them that shall dwell in it, and they that dwell devour thee, shall be far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of thy barrenness shall say again in thine ears, The place is strait for me: give place to me that I may dwell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say in thine heart, Who hath begotten me these, seeing I am barren and desolate, a captive and a wanderer to and fro? and who hath nourished them? behold, I was left alone: whence are these?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people, and they shall bring thy sons in their arms: and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and Queens shall be thy nurses: they shall worship thee with their faces toward the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet: and thou shalt know that I am the Lord: for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty? or the just captivity delivered?
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus saith the Lord, Even the captivity of the mighty shall be taken away: and the prey of the tyrant shall be delivered: for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children,
speaker: Narrator

text: And will feed them that spoil thee, with their own flesh, and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall know that I the Lord am thy Savior and thy Redeemer, the mighty one of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Where is that bill of your mother’s divorcement, whom I have cast off? or who is the creditor to whom I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities are ye sold, and because of your transgressions is your mother forsaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore came I, and there was no man? I called, and none answered: is mine hand so shortened, that it cannot help? or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea: I make the floods desert; their fish rotteth for want of water, and dieth for thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: I clothe the heavens with darkness, and make a sack their covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God hath given me a tongue of the learned, that I should know to minister a word in time to him that is weary; he will raise me up in the morning, in the morning he will waken mine ear to hear, as the learned.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned I back.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave my back unto the smiters, and my cheeks to the nippers: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is near that justifieth me: who will contend with me? Let us stand together? who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord God will help me: who is he that can condemn me? lo, they shall wax old as a garment: the moth shall eat them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is among you that feareth the Lord? let him hear the voice of his servant: he that walketh in darkness and hath no light, let him trust in the Name of the Lord, and stay upon his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all you kindle a fire, and are compassed about with sparks: walk in the light of your fire, and in the sparks that ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand: ye shall lie down in sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me ye that follow after righteousness, and ye that seek the Lord: look unto the rock, whence you are hewn, and to the hole of the pit, whence ye are dug.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider Abraham your father, and Sarah that bare you: for I called him alone, and blessed him and increased him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the Lord shall comfort Zion: he shall comfort all her desolations, and he shall make her desert like Eden, and her wilderness like the garden of the Lord: joy and gladness shall be found therein: praise, and the voice of singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken ye unto me my people, and give ear unto me, O my people: for a Law shall proceed from me, and I will bring forth my judgment for the light of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: My righteousness is near: my salvation goeth forth, and mine arm shall judge the people: the isles shall wait for me, and shall trust unto mine arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, and look upon the earth beneath: for the heavens shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth shall wax old like a garment, and they that dwell therein, shall perish in like manner: but my salvation shall be forever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my Law. Fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their rebukes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wood: but my righteousness shall be forever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up, Rise up, and put on strength, O arm of the Lord: rise up as in the old time in the generations of the world. Art not thou the same, that hath cut Rahab, and wounded the dragon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art not thou the same, which hath dried the Sea, even the waters of the great deep, making the depth of the sea a way for the redeemed to pass over?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the redeemed of the Lord shall return, and come with joy unto Zion, and everlasting joy shall be upon their head: they shall obtain joy and gladness: and sorrow and mourning shall flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, even I am he that comfort you. Who art thou that thou shouldest fear a mortal man, and the son of man, which shall be made as grass?
speaker: Narrator

text: And forgettest the Lord thy maker, that hath spread out the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth? and hast feared continually all the day, because of the rage of the oppressor, which is ready to destroy? Where is now the rage of the oppressor?
speaker: Narrator

text: The captive hasteneth to be loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that his bread should fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am the Lord thy God that divided the sea, when his waves roared: the Lord of hosts is his Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have put my words in thy mouth, and have defended thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundation of the earth, and say unto Zion, Thou art my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awake, awake, and stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the cup of his wrath: thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling, and wrung them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is none to guide her among all her sons, whom she hath brought forth: there is none that taketh her by the hand of all the sons that she hath brought up.
speaker: Narrator

text: These two things are come unto thee: who will lament thee? desolation and destruction and famine, and the sword: by whom shall I comfort thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy sons have fainted, and lie at the head of all the streets as a wild bull in a net, and are full of the wrath of the Lord, and rebuke of thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hear now this, thou miserable and drunken, but not with wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith thy Lord God, even God that pleadeth the cause of his people, Behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, even the dregs of the cup of my wrath: thou shalt drink it no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will put it into their hand that spoil thee, which have said to thy soul, Bow down that we may go over, and thou hast laid thy body as the ground, and as the streets to them that went over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, arise: put on thy strength, O Zion: put on the garments of thy beauty, O Jerusalem, the holy City: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shake thyself from the dust, arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose the bands of thy neck, O thou captive daughter Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord, Ye were sold for naught; therefore shall ye be redeemed without money.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord God, My people went down afore time into Egypt to sojourn there, and Assyria oppressed them without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore what have I here, saith the Lord, that my people is taken away for naught, and they that rule over them, make them to howl, saith the Lord? and my Name all the day continually is blasphemed?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day, that I am he that do speak: behold, it is I.
speaker: Narrator

text: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him, that declareth and publisheth peace! that declareth good tidings, and publisheth salvation, saying unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of thy watchmen shall be heard: they shall lift up their voice, and shout together: for they shall see eye to eye, when the Lord shall bring again Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye desolate places of Jerusalem, be glad and rejoice together, for the Lord hath comforted his people: he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath made bare his holy arm in the sight of all the Gentiles, and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart, depart ye: go ye out from thence, and touch no unclean thing, go out of the midst of her, be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor depart by fleeing away: but the Lord will go before you, and the God of Israel will gather you together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, my servant shall prosper: he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many were astonied at thee (his visage was so deformed of men, and his form of the sons of men) so shall he sprinkle many nations: the Kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them, shall they see, and that which they had not heard shall they understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will believe our report? and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall grow up before him as a branch, and as a root out of a dry ground; he hath neither form nor beauty: when we shall see him, there shall be no form that we should desire him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is despised and rejected of men: he is a man full of sorrows, and hath experience of infirmities: we hid as it were our faces from him: he was despised, and we esteemed him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely, he hath born our infirmities, and carried our sorrows, yet we did judge him as plagued and smitten of God, and humbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was wounded for our transgressions: he was broken for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him, and with his stripes are we healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: All we like sheep have gone astray: we have turned every one to his own way, and the Lord hath laid upon him the iniquity of us all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet did he not open his mouth: he is brought as a sheep to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearer is dumb, so he opened not his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was taken out from prison, and from judgment: and who shall declare his age? for he was cut out of the land of the living: for the transgression of my people was he plagued.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death, though he had done no wickedness, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Lord would break him and make him subject to infirmities: when he shall make his soul an offering for sin, he shall see his seed and shall prolong his days, and the will of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall see of the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied; by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many: for he shall bear their iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I give him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong, because he hath poured out his soul unto death; and he was counted with the transgressors, and he bare the sin of many, and prayed for the trespassers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice, O barren that didst not bear: break forth into joy and rejoice, thou that didst not travail with child; for the desolate hath more children than the married wife, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enlarge the place of thy tents, and let them spread out the curtains of thine habitations: spare not: stretch out thy cords, and make fast thy stakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou shalt increase on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall possess the Gentiles, and dwell in the desolate cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear not: for thou shalt not be ashamed, neither shalt thou be confounded: for thou shalt not be put to shame: yea, thou shalt forget the shame of thy youth, and shalt not remember the reproach of thy widowhood anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that made thee, is thine husband, (whose name is the Lord of hosts) and thy redeemer the holy One of Israel, shall be called the God of the whole world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath called thee, being as a woman forsaken, and afflicted in spirit, and as a young wife when thou wast refused, saith thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a little while have I forsaken thee, but with great compassion will I gather thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a moment in mine anger, I hid my face from thee for a little season, but with everlasting mercy have I had compassion on thee, saith the Lord thy redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is unto me as the waters of Noah; for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah should no more go over the earth, so have I sworn that I would not be angry with thee, nor rebuke thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the mountains shall remove, and the hills shall fall down; but my mercy shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace fall away, saith the Lord, that hath compassion on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: O thou afflicted and tossed with tempest, that hast no comfort, behold, I will lay thy stones with the carbuncle, and lay thy foundation with sapphires,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thy windows of emeralds, and thy gates shining stones, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all thy children shall be taught of the Lord, and much peace shall be to thy children.
speaker: Narrator

text: In righteousness shalt thou be established, and be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear it: and from fear; for it shall not come near thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the enemies shall gather himself, but without me: whosoever shall gather himself in thee, against thee, shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and him that bringeth forth an instrument for his work, and I have created the destroyer to destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the weapons that are made against thee, shall not prosper: and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment, thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the Lord’s servants, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ho, everyone that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and ye that have no silver, come, buy and eat: come, I say, buy wine and milk without silver and without money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore do ye lay out silver, and not for bread? and your labor without being satisfied? hearken diligently unto me, and eat that which is good, and let your soul delight in fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline your ears, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall live, and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I gave him for a witness to the people, for a prince and a master unto the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thou shalt call a nation that thou knowest not, and a nation that knew not thee, shall run unto thee because of the Lord thy God, and the Holy one of Israel: for he hath glorified thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seek ye the Lord while he may be found: call ye upon him while he is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the wicked forsake his ways, and the unrighteous his own imaginations, and return unto the Lord, and he will have mercy upon him; and to our God, for he is very ready to forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, and my thoughts above your thoughts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely as the rain cometh down, and the snow from heaven, and returneth not thither but watereth the earth, and maketh it to bring forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower, and bread unto him that eateth,
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall my word be, that goeth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I will, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace; the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into joy, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thorns there shall grow fir trees; for nettles shall grow the myrrh tree, and it shall be to the Lord for a name, and for an everlasting sign that shall not be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Keep judgment and do justice, for my salvation is at hand to come, and my righteousness to be revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that doeth this, and the son of man which layeth hold on it; he that keepeth the Sabbath, and polluteth it not, and keepeth his hand from doing any evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let not the son of the strangers, which is joined to the Lord, speak and say, The Lord hath surely separated me from his people; neither let the Eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord unto the Eunuchs that keep my Sabbaths, and choose the thing that pleaseth me, and take hold of my covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: Even unto them will I give in mine House and within my walls, a place, and a name better than of the sons and of the daughters; I will give them an everlasting name, that shall not be put out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the strangers that cleave unto the Lord, to serve him, and to love the Name of the Lord, and to be his servants; everyone that keepeth the Sabbath, and polluteth it not, and embraceth my covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: Them will I bring also to mine holy mountain, and make them joyful in mine House of prayer; their burnt offerings and their sacrifices shall be accepted upon mine altar: for mine house shall be called an house of prayer for all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God saith, which gathereth the scattered of Israel, Yet will I gather to them those that are to be gathered to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, even all ye beasts of the forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their watchmen are all blind: they have no knowledge: they are all dumb dogs: they cannot bark: they lie and sleep, and delight in sleeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these greedy dogs can never have enough: and these shepherds cannot understand: for they all look to their own way, everyone for his advantage, and for his own purpose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, I will bring wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink, and tomorrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous perisheth, and no man considereth it in heart, and merciful men are taken away, and no man understandeth that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace shall come: they shall rest in their beds, everyone that walketh before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you witches’ children, come hither, the seed of the adulterer and of the whore.
speaker: Narrator

text: On whom have ye jested? upon whom have ye gaped and thrust out your tongue? are not ye rebellious children, and a false seed?
speaker: Narrator

text: Inflamed with idols under every green tree? and sacrificing the children in the valleys under the tops of the rocks?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy portion is in the smooth stones of the river: they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering: thou hast offered a sacrifice. Should I delight in these?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast made thy bed upon a very high mountain: thou wentest up thither, even thither wentest thou to offer sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behind the doors also and posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another, than me, and wentest up, and didst enlarge thy bed, and make a covenant between thee and them, and lovedst their bed in every place where thou sawest it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wentest to the kings with oil, and didst increase thine ointments, and send thy messengers far off, and didst humble thyself unto hell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou weariedst thyself in thy manifold journeys, yet saidest thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found life by thine hand, therefore thou wast not grieved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whom didst thou reverence or fear, seeing thou hast lied unto me, and hast not remembered me, neither set thy mind thereon? is it not because I hold my peace, and that of long time? therefore thou fearest not me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will declare thy righteousness and thy works, and they shall not profit thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou cryest, let them that thou hast gathered together, deliver thee: but the wind shall take them all away: vanity shall pull them away: but he that trusteth in me shall inherit the land, and shall possess mine holy Mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall say, Cast up, cast up: prepare the way: take up the stumbling blocks out of the way of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith he that is high and excellent, he that inhabiteth the eternity, whose Name is the Holy one, I dwell in the high and holy place: with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit to revive the spirit of the humble, and to give life to them that are of a contrite heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will not contend forever: neither will I be always wroth, for the spirit should fail before me: and I have made the breath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his wicked covetousness I am angry with him, and have smitten him: I hid me, and was angry, yet he went away, and turned after the way of his own heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comfort unto him, and to those that lament him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I create the fruit of the lips, to be peace: peace unto them that are far off, and to them that are near, saith the Lord: for I will heal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked are like the raging sea, that cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cry aloud, spare not: lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and show my people their transgression, and to the house of Jacob their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they seek me daily, and will know my ways, even as a nation that did righteously, and had not forsaken the statutes of their God: they ask of me the ordinances of justice: they will draw near unto God, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore have we fasted, and thou seest it not? we have punished ourselves, and thou regardest it not. Behold, in the day of your fast you will seek your will, and require all your debts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye fast to strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do today, to make your voice to be heard above.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it such a fast that I have chosen, that a man should afflict his soul for a day, and to bow down his head, as a bull rush, and to lie down in sackcloth and ashes? wilt thou call this a fasting, or an acceptable day to the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the fasting that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness, to take off the heavy burdens, and to let the oppressed go free, and that ye break every yoke?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it not to deal thy bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the poor that wander, unto thine house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him, and hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall grow speedily: thy righteousness shall go before thee, and the glory of the Lord shall embrace thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou call, and the Lord shall answer: thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I am: if thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and wicked speaking:
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou pour out thy soul to the hungry, and refresh the troubled soul: then shall thy light spring out in the darkness, and thy darkness shall be as the noon day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones, and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be of thee, that shall build the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the foundations for many generations, and thou shalt be called the repairer of the breach, and the restorer of the paths to dwell in.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou turn away thy foot from the Sabbath, from doing thy will on mine Holy day, and call the Sabbath a delight to consecrate it, as glorious to the Lord, and shalt honor him, not doing thine own ways, nor seeking thine own will, nor speaking a vain word,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou delight in the Lord, and I will cause thee to mount upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord’s hand is not shortened, that it cannot save: neither is his ear heavy, that it cannot hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But your iniquities have separated between you and your God, and your sins have hid his face from you, that he will not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with iniquity: your lips have spoken lies, and your tongue hath murmured iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man calleth for justice: no man contendeth for truth: they trust in vanity, and speak vain things: they conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hatch cockatrice eggs, and weave the spider’s web: he that eateth of their eggs, died, and that which is trode upon, breaketh out into a serpent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their webs shall be no garment, neither shall they cover themselves with their labors: for their works are works of iniquities, and the work of cruelty is in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their feet turn to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are wicked thoughts: desolation and destruction is in their paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of peace they know not, and there is none equity in their goings: they have made them crooked paths: whosoever goeth therein, shall not know peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore is judgment far from us, neither doth justice come near unto us: we wait for light, but lo, it is darkness: for brightness, but we walk in darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: We grope for the wall like the blind, and we grope as one without eyes: we stumble at the noon day as in the twilight: we are in solitary places, as dead men.
speaker: Narrator

text: We roar all like bears, and mourn like doves: we look for equity, but there is none: for health, but it is far from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our trespasses are many before thee, and our sins testify against us: for our trespasses are with us, and we know our iniquities
speaker: Narrator

text: In trespassing and lying against the Lord, and we have departed away from our God, and have spoken of cruelty and rebellion, conceiving and uttering out of the heart false matters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore judgment is turned backward, and justice standeth far off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equity cannot enter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, truth faileth, and he that refraineth from evil, maketh himself a prey: and when the Lord saw it, it displeased him, that there was no judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he saw that there was no man, he wondered that none would offer himself. Therefore his arm did save it, and his righteousness itself did sustain it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he put on righteousness, as an habergeon, and an helmet of salvation upon his head, and he put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, and was clad with zeal as a cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to make recompense, as to requite the fury of the adversaries with a recompense to his enemies: he will fully repair the islands.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall they fear the Name of the Lord from the West, and his glory from the rising of the Sun; for the enemy shall come like a flood; but the Spirit of the Lord shall chase him away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Redeemer shall come unto Zion, and unto them that turn from iniquity in Jacob, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make this my Covenant with them, saith the Lord, My Spirit that is upon thee, and my words, which I have put in thy mouth, shall not depart out of thy mouth, nor out of the mouth of thy seed, nor out of the mouth of the seed of thy seed, saith the Lord, from henceforth even forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, O Jerusalem; be bright, for thy light is come, and the glory of the Lord is risen upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold, darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the people; but the Lord shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gentiles shall walk in thy light, and Kings at the brightness of thy rising up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lift up thine eyes round about, and behold: all these are gathered, and come to thee: thy sons shall come from far, and thy daughters shall be nourished at thy side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt see and shine: thine heart shall be astonied and enlarged, because the multitude of the sea shall be converted unto thee, and the riches of the Gentiles shall come unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The multitude of camels shall cover thee: and the dromedaries of Midian and of Ephah: all they of Sheba shall come: they shall bring gold and incense, and show forth the praises of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the sheep of Kedar shall be gathered unto thee: the rams of Nebajoth shall serve thee: they shall come up to be accepted upon mine altar: and I will beautify the house of my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who are these that fly like a cloud, and as the doves to their windows?
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely the isles shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish, as at the beginning, that they may bring thy sons from far, and their silver and their gold with them unto the Name of the Lord thy God, and to the Holy one of Israel, because he hath glorified thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of strangers shall build up thy walls, and their Kings shall minister unto thee: for in my wrath I smote thee, but in my mercy I had compassion on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thy gates shall be open continually: neither day nor night shall they be shut, that men may bring unto thee the riches of the Gentiles, and that their kings may be brought.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the nation and the kingdom, that will not serve thee, shall perish: and those nations shall be utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of Lebanon shall come unto thee, the fir tree, the elm and the box tree together to beautify the place of my Sanctuary: for I will glorify the place of my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons also of them that afflicted thee, shall come and bow unto thee: and all they that despised thee, shall fall down at the soles of thy feet: and they shall call thee; The city of the Lord, Zion of the Holy one of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereas thou hast been forsaken and hated, so that no man went by thee, I will make thee an eternal glory, and a joy from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also suck the milk of the Gentiles, and shalt suck the breasts of Kings: and thou shalt know, that I the Lord am thy Savior, and thy Redeemer, the mighty one of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: For brass will I bring gold, and for iron will I bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron. I will also make thy government peace, and thine exactors righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Violence shall no more be heard of in thy land, neither desolation, nor destruction within thy borders: but thou shalt call salvation, thy walls, and praise, thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have no more Sun to shine by day, neither shall the brightness of the Moon shine unto thee: for the Lord shall be thine everlasting light, and thy God, thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy Sun shall never go down, neither shall thy Moon be hid: for the Lord shall be thine everlasting light, and the days of thy sorrow shall be ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy people also shall be all righteous: they shall possess the land forever, the grass of my planting shall be the work of mine hands, that I may be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little one shall become as a thousand, and a small one as a strong nation: I the Lord will hasten it in due time.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit of the Lord God is upon me, therefore hath the Lord anointed me: he hath sent me to preach good tidings unto the poor, to bind up the broken hearted, to preach liberty to the captives, and to them that are bound, the opening of the prison,
speaker: Narrator

text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord, and the day of vengeance of our God, to comfort all that mourn,
speaker: Narrator

text: To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, and to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of gladness for the spirit of heaviness, that they might be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that he might be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall build the old waste places, and raise up the former desolations, and they shall repair the cities that were desolate and waste through many generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strangers shall stand and feed your sheep, and the sons of the strangers shall be your plowmen, and dressers of your vines.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall be named the Priests of the Lord, and men shall say unto you, The ministers of our God: Ye shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, and shall be exalted with their glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your shame you shall receive double, and for confusion, they shall rejoice in their portion: for in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I the Lord love judgment, and hate robbery for burnt offering, and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their seed shall be known among the Gentiles, and their buds among the people. All that see them, shall know them, that they are the seed which the Lord hath blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, and my soul shall be joyful in my God: for he hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, and covered me with the robe of righteousness: he hath decked me like a bridegroom, and as a bride attireth herself with her jewels.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden causeth to grow that which is sown in it: so the Lord God will cause righteousness to grow, and praise before all the heathen.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Zion’s sake I will not hold my tongue, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof break forth as the light, and salvation thereof as a burning lamp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all Kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord shall name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord, and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall no more be said unto thee, Forsaken, neither shall it be said anymore to thy land, Desolate, but thou shalt be called Hephzibah, and thy land Beulah: for the Lord delighteth in thee, and thy land shalt have an husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as a bridegroom is glad of the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which all the day and all the night continual shall not cease: ye that are mindful of the Lord, keep not silence,
speaker: Narrator

text: And give him no rest, till he repair, and until he set up Jerusalem the praise of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath sworn by his right hand and by his strong arm, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies, and surely the sons of the strangers shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast labored.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they that have gathered it, shall eat it, and praise the Lord, and the gatherers thereof shall drink it in the courts of my Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go through, go through the gates: prepare you the way for the people: cast up, cast up the way, and gather out the stones, and set up a standard for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord hath proclaimed unto the ends of the world, tell the daughter Zion, Behold, thy Savior cometh: Behold, his wages is with him, and his work is before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall call them, The holy people, the redeemed of the Lord, and thou shalt be named, A city sought out and not forsaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is this that cometh from Edom, with red garments from Bozrah? he is glorious in his apparel, and walketh in his great strength. I speak in righteousness, and am mighty to save.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore is thine apparel red, and thy garments like him that treadeth in the winepress?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have trodden the winepress alone, and of all people there was none with me: for I will tread them in mine anger, and tread them under foot in my wrath, and their blood shall be sprinkled upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the day of vengeance is in mine heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I looked, and there was none to help, and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore mine own arm helped me, and my wrath itself sustained me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will tread down the people in my wrath, and make them drunken in mine indignation, and will bring down their strength to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will remember the mercy of the Lord, and the praises of the Lord, according unto all that the Lord hath given us, and for the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he hath given them according to his tender love, and according to his great mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said, Surely they are my people, children that will not lie: so he was their Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all their troubles he was troubled, and the Angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his mercy he redeemed them, and he bare them and carried them always continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they rebelled and vexed his holy Spirit: therefore was he turned to be their enemy, and he fought against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he remembered the old time of Moses and his people, saying, Where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his sheep? Where is he that put his holy Spirit within him?
speaker: Narrator

text: He led them by the right hand of Moses with his own glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make himself an everlasting Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He led them through the deep, as an horse in the wilderness, that they should not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the beast goeth down into the valley, the Spirit of the Lord gave them rest: so didst thou lead thy people, to make thyself a glorious Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from heaven, and behold from the dwelling place of thine holiness, and of thy glory. Where is thy zeal and thy strength, the multitude of thy mercies, and of thy compassion? they are restrained from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doubtless thou art our Father: though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Israel know us not, yet thou, O Lord, art our Father, and our redeemer: thy Name is forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, why hast thou made us to err from thy ways? and hardened our heart from thy fear? Return for thy servant’s sake, and for the tribes of thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of thine holiness have possessed it, but a little while: for our adversaries have trodden down thy Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have been as they, over whom thou never barest rule, and upon whom thy name was not called.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh, that thou wouldest break the heavens, and come down, and that the mountains might melt at thy presence!
speaker: Narrator

text: As the melting fire burned, as the fire caused the waters to boil, (that thou mightest declare thy Name to thine adversaries) the people did tremble at thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou didst terrible things, which we looked not for, thou camest down, and the mountains melted at thy presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For since the beginning of the world, they have not heard nor understood with the ear, neither hath the eye seen another God beside thee, which doeth so to him that waiteth for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou didst meet him, that rejoiced in thee, and did justly: they remembered thee in thy ways: behold, thou art angry, for we have sinned: yet in them is continuance, and we shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we have all been as an unclean thing, and all our righteousness is as filthy cloths, and we all do fade like a leaf, and our iniquities like the wind have taken us away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there is none that calleth upon thy Name, neither that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us because of our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, O Lord, thou art our Father: we are the clay, and thou art our potter, and we all are the work of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not angry, O Lord, above measure, neither remember iniquity forever: Lo, we beseech thee, behold, we are all thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine holy cities lie waste: Zion is a wilderness, and Jerusalem a desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: The house of our Sanctuary, and of our glory, where our fathers praised thee, is burnt up with fire, and all our pleasant things are wasted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou hold thyself still at these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace and afflict us above measure?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been sought of them that asked not: I was found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that called not upon my Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have spread out mine hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walked in a way that was not good, even after their own imaginations.
speaker: Narrator

text: A people that provoked me ever unto my face: that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon bricks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the deserts, which eat swine’s flesh, and the broth of things polluted are in their vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which say, Stand apart, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou; these are a smoke in my wrath, and a fire that burneth all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, it is written before me; I will not keep silence, but will render it and recompense it into their bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers, shall be together (saith the Lord) which have burnt incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills; therefore will I measure their old work into their bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, As the wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not, for a blessing is in it, so will I do for my servants’ sakes, that I may not destroy them whole.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will bring a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah that shall inherit my mountain; and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sharon shall be a sheepfold, and the valley of Achor shall be a resting place for the cattle of my people, that have sought me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye are they that have forsaken the Lord, and forgotten mine holy Mountain, and have prepared a table for the multitude, and furnish the drink offerings unto the number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and all you shall bow down to the slaughter, because I called, and ye did not answer; I spake, and ye heard not, but did evil in my sight, and did choose that thing which I would not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, my servants shall eat, and ye shall be hungry; behold, my servants shall drink, and ye shall be thirsty; behold, my servants shall rejoice, and ye shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, and ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall leave your name as a curse unto my chosen; for the Lord God shall slay you, and call his servants by another name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that shall bless in the earth, shall bless himself in the true God; and he that sweareth in the earth, shall swear by the true God; for the former troubles are forgotten, and shall surely hide themselves from mine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For lo, I will create new heavens and a new earth; and the former shall not be remembered nor come into mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be you glad and rejoice forever in the things that I shall create; for behold, I will create Jerusalem, as a rejoicing, and her people as a joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people, and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be no more there a child of years, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for he that shall be an hundred years old, shall die as a young man: but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall build houses, and inhabit them, and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not build, and another inhabit: they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of the tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall enjoy in old age the work of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not labor in vain, nor bring forth in fear: for they are the seed of the blessed of the Lord, and their buds with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, before they call, I will answer, and whiles they speak, I will hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and to the serpent dust shall be his meat. They shall no more hurt nor destroy in all mine holy Mountain, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where is that house that ye will build unto me? and where is that place of my rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: For all these things hath mine hand made, and all these things have been, saith the Lord: and to him will I look, even to him that is poor, and of a contrite spirit, and trembleth at my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that killeth a bullock, is as if he slew a man: he that sacrificeth a sheep, as if he cut off a dog’s neck: he that offereth an oblation, as if he offered swine’s blood: he that remembereth incense, as if he blessed an idol: yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore will I choose out their delusions, and I will bring their fear upon them, because I called and none would answer: I speak, and they would not hear: but they did evil in my sight, and chose the things which I would not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear the word of the Lord, all ye that tremble at his word, Your brethren that hated you, and cast you out for my Name’s sake, said, Let the Lord be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice soundeth from the city, even a voice from the Temple, the voice of the Lord, that recompenseth his enemies fully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before she travailed, she brought forth: and before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? shall the earth be brought forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I cause to travail, and not bring forth? shall I cause to bring forth, and shall be barren, saith thy God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her,
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolation: that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the brightness of her glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord, behold, I will extend peace over her like a flood, and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: then shall ye suck, ye shall be born upon her sides, and be joyful upon her knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: As one whom his mother comforteth, so will I comfort you, and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye see this, your hearts shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like an herb: and the hand of the Lord shall be known among his servants, and his indignation against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold, the Lord will come with fire, and his chariots like a whirlwind, that he may recompense his anger with wrath, and his indignation with the flame of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will judge with fire, and with his sword all flesh, and the flame of the Lord shall be many.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens behind one tree in the midst eating swine’s flesh, and such abomination, even the mouse, shall be consumed together, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will visit their works, and their imaginations, for it shall come that I will gather all nations, and tongues, and they shall come, and see my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set a sign among them, and will send those that escape of them unto the nations of Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, and to them that draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, isles afar off, that have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory, and they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the Lord out of all nations, upon horses, and in chariots, and in horse litters, and upon mules, and swift beasts, to Jerusalem mine holy Mountain, saith the Lord, as the children of Israel offer in a clean vessel in the House of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will take of them for Priests, and for Levites, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the new heavens, and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith the Lord, so shall your seed and your name continue.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from month to month, and from Sabbath to Sabbath shall all flesh come to worship before me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched, and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
speaker: Narrator
